channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou jets off to Palma to investigate a yacht thought to be worth £150,000, while Prestige Pawnbrokers' memorabilia expert Lawrence values a guitar signed by Oasis. An impressive diamond bracelet gives new branch manager Alicja a chance to secure an international client and a vivacious prospective customer hopes the proceeds from the sale of a set of designer handbags might help get a new business venture off the ground.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: A teenage girl passes through the doors of Prestige Pawnbrokers, seeking to sell her grandfather's designer watch in an effort to fund her fledgling jewellery business. History expert Lawrence is delighted when he is presented with an autographed 1960s racing programme, and an online customer is shocked by the valuation received by her collection of luxury items. Plus, boss James Constantinou ends up crashing a converted double-decker bus when he takes it for a test drive.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for a Cambridgeshire home for Mary and David, who recently became parents for the first time. However, they are also challenged to find a house for the baby's maternal grandparents Edna and George, who have moved to the area to be close to their extended family.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steve Greenbaum goes undercover among the workforce of his company PostNet, which offers design, printing and shipping services to small businesses. Posing as a failed motorcycle shop owner, he tries to find out how his staff are responding to firms that have been hit by the global recession.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jim Rogers, chairman and CEO of Kampgrounds of America, goes undercover within his own company to discover whether his employees share his boy-scout philosophy. However, Jim's wife Sandy fears his naturally outgoing and cheerful nature could undo his cover story as a recently unemployed reality show contestant.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Float by Boat near Rugby, partners Kev Argent and Tor Johnson run mindfulness breaks from their narrowboat, but Alison and Lynda are not keen on the tiny shared bathroom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Contestants try to outdo one another by throwing the perfect dinner party, which is then judged on its merits by their rivals.(n)

programme.desc: Contestants try to outdo one another by throwing the perfect dinner party, which is then judged on its merits by their rivals.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Denmark v Austria.
programme.desc: Denmark v Austria (Kick-off 5.00pm). Coverage of the opening semi-final, held at the Rat Verlegh Stadion in Breda, the Netherlands. The team to emerge victorious from this match will progress to the final, which is due to take place on Sunday. Channel 4 News is on More4 tonight.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps mother and daughter Rhona Brennan and Nina find the perfect family holiday home that could also work as a B&B in the French region of Limousin.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined by First Dates love ambassador Fred Sirieix, food critic Jay Rayner, deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put fish pie, lager and smoked bacon to the test. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test this time is for garlic bread.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty takes to the skies above Israel as he joins the battle to protect the bell pepper crop from the Mediterranean fruit fly, while Kate Quilton investigates premium-priced manuka honey, which is marketed for its anti-bacterial properties. Matt Tebbutt visits the UK's largest leek producer, where he's shocked by how much of the vegetable goes to waste, but amazed by a mobile factory on wheels that can process 60,000 leeks a day.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Part one of two. For six weeks, 10 four year olds will share their classroom with 11 pensioners. In an experiment led by three geriatric specialists, the young and older group follow the same timetable in a new nursery set within a retirement village near Bristol. The senior group will undergo tests to measure mood, memory and mobility during their daily interaction with the kids.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Ten four year olds are half way through an ambitious six-week experiment, as they share their classroom with 11 pensioners who all follow the same timetable in a nursery near Bristol. Has the energy and activities of the younger group had a measurable impact on the pensioners? Can this ambitious experiment transform the way Britain cares for its increasingly older population?.(n)

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents a Top 50 countdown of hilarious, jaw-dropping internet clips featuring the most super-powered online animal moments, from the bear burglar to a gangster crab and the scary truth about how raccoons are taking over the internet.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Two-year-old Labrador Ira is fitted with a bionic spine, while anxious owner Rob brings in eight-year-old French bulldog Tom with a long list of chronic ailments. Matt and Rebecca arrive at the clinic with their three-year-old cat Marley, who may need to have a leg amputated.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: The young TV viewers offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on First Dates, Nature's Weirdest Events and classic movie Dirty Dancing. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Public Enemies: Jay-Z vs Kanye
programme.desc: Documentary charting the rise to fame of the rappers and how their hopes and ambitions led to a falling out between them, featuring previously unseen footage and interviews with the people who know them best. The film tells the story of a creative partnership spanning two decades and reveals an even bigger story of how race, wealth and celebrity are shaping modern America.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of six potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 43-year-old Cathy from Hertfordshire who, with her biological clock ticking, is wanting to settle down and have children. The trouble is she's open to dating men from their 20s to their 60s and finds it hard to choose. Will she find it easier to pick the right partner when they're all naked? Then, 24-year-old Londoner Adam takes centre stage. He hates online dating and has decided to bare all in order to find the perfect match.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: The Royals have gathered at Balmoral, where Camilla is determined to exact revenge on Theresa May, who is in Scotland to stop Nicola Sturgeon destroying the union. Meanwhile, Charles is a hit with the Scots when it is revealed he has got no underwear on under his kilt, and Wills is shot by a wild Highland lassie, but who is the mysterious woman? Elsewhere, Meghan Markle is thrilled to get a part in Hollyoaks, but Pippa is determined to end Meghan and Harry's relationship. Starring Harry Enfield, Haydn Gwynne and Hugh Skinner.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Luke continues to cause confrontation among the group, while another one of the jurors just cannot wait to leave.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: More customers arrive at Prestige Pawnbrokers, including a woman and her son, who are hoping to secure a loan against a 71-carat tanzanite ring they bought from a home-shopping channel. Prestige boss James Constantinou takes a shine to a bespoke show motorbike, and must fight against his instinct to claim the vehicle for himself as he seeks a buyer. Plus, a collection of 500 handbags arrives for valuation.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An Ibiza club DJ plans to take her act beyond the shores of the party island, but needs funds to push herself into the global limelight, and hopes the sale of her designer goods will give her the money she needs to achieve her ambition. Enter handbag specialist Claudia, James Constantinou's fiancee, who offers the customer a big surprise. Meanwhile, Alicja gets excited when she claps eyes on a vintage gold and diamond timepiece, and Prestige boss James hopes to recoup his losses when an unredeemed Aston Martin goes to auction.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help prospective buyers in Kent search for their ideal homes. In Broadstairs, Caroline and Ian are hoping to find a house for their growing family, while twentysomethings Sophie and Niall are looking for their first property in Maidstone.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jim Rogers, chairman and CEO of Kampgrounds of America, goes undercover within his own company to discover whether his employees share his boy-scout philosophy. However, Jim's wife Sandy fears his naturally outgoing and cheerful nature could undo his cover story as a recently unemployed reality show contestant.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: John Wilson, the President and Chief Operating Officer of Rollins Incorporated - the parent company of eight pest-control firms including flagship brand Orkin - goes undercover. He poses as a contestant on a reality TV competition who is trying to win money for his own business, and works alongside his employees to make sure the organisation is heading for another century of keeping homes rodent-free.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Miners Arms in Nenthead, Cumbria, where sisters Alison Baker and Lynda Clark hope to impress guests with their eco credentials.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: First aid manager Jacqui hosts the first dinner party in Perth, where she plans to impress her guests, optometric consultant Daniel, cabinet-maker Craig, administrator Lorea and procurement officer Jenna with her hearty cuisine, including a sticky toffee pudding.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Aspiring actor Daniel hosts the second dinner party in Perthshire, and hopes to impress his fellow contestants with a twist on the traditional Scottish menu - serving spaghetti hagginaise for his main and soft-drink flavoured ice-cream for dessert. But with outspoken guest Jenna admitting her dislike for the host, the attention is diverted away from the food.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: For the third party from Perthshire, Lorea is on a mission to showcase the culinary delights of her native home in northern Spain, and her fiesta commences with a pink cocktail and an exotic quartet flown over from the Basque country especially to impress. She reveals that she used to model in the nude, which perplexes her guests, and there are tensions at bay between Daniel and Jenna, which threaten to spoil the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Procurement officer Jenna hosts the fourth night of the competition in Perthshire, and tries to deliver the perfect evening. However, she struggles to hide her feelings toward aspiring actor Daniel after they have bickered all week, despite first aid manager Jacqui's attempts at reconciliation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final day in Perth, and Kiwi Craig's turn to throw a dinner party before the winner is named. He hopes that his land and sea menu of prime lobster and wild boar will see him score highly, but hadn't counted on Jenna and Craig's tiara quarrel from the night before raging on into his evening. The host tries his best to calm the couple, but tensions mount to the point where cutlery is slammed down and one guest storms out.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two families in the south-east of England struggling to find new homes. Paul and Stephanie's house is bursting at the seams as the couple try to run three businesses and bring up three boys in the property, while Noni and partner George relocated to her mother's spare bedroom after the arrival of their first child and have been searching for their own place for six months.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies shows a number of properties to Robin and Susan Loxton from Suffolk, who want to buy a holiday home around the area of Mijas, their favourite part of southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help prospective buyers in Kent search for their ideal homes. In Broadstairs, Caroline and Ian are hoping to find a house for their growing family, while twentysomethings Sophie and Niall are looking for their first property in Maidstone.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers in London. The programme's youngest-ever house-hunter, 18-year-old student Claire Winship, has had cerebral palsy from birth and uses a wheelchair. With a budget of £1.7million, she wants a property with good investment potential, plenty of accessible space and a view of the Thames. Meanwhile, trainee fashion buyer Geri and her carpenter boyfriend Arran are looking for a one-bedroom flat near Crouch End in north London, and have £280,000 to spend.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The dads are under the spotlight at Liverpool Women's Hospital as three very different men prepare for fatherhood. Midwife Kirsty looks after Rebecca and Jack, a soldier who's more confident about going into battle than he is about changing nappies. Mum Billie arrives with her ex-partner Nathan, and although they're apart, they hope they can raise their child together. Cameras also follow John, who has always wanted to be a dad. He hopes some of his broodiness will rub off on girlfriend Natalie.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Croydon mates Josh and Jack take part in a double date, but problems arise after they meet Morgan and Jasmine, and both fall for the same girl. Meanwhile, divorced mum-of-two Sandy hopes to find romance with an astrology expert Steve, though incompatible star signs may be a problem. And tomboy boat-builder Abbey returns to the restaurant, but will she find a soul mate in Eddie, an odd job man who's nervous around women?.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments. Brian and Graham have been warned to expect trouble as they evict some tenants from a south London flat, one of whom has a reputation for violence. Everything goes smoothly until the enforcement agents make a shocking discovery in a child's bedroom. Paul and Steve head to Slough to collect wages owed to a freelance worker, but the debtor is less than happy to find the high-court enforcement officers on his doorstep and things get physical.(n)

programme.desc: The naive survivors of an apparent ecological disaster work, rest and play inside their utopian sealed community in the year 2019, each hoping to win a ticket to an idyllic island in a regular lottery draw. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ewan McGregor, Scarlett Johansson, Sean Bean and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: Parker
programme.desc: A thief is betrayed and left for dead by his partners in crime. He learns they are planning a diamond heist in a wealthy neighbourhood, so poses as a millionaire wanting to buy a house in the area. A real-estate agent sees through the disguise and helps him get even by stealing the gems from his traitorous gang. Action thriller, with Jason Statham and Jennifer Lopez.(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Disgruntled Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbour, a Hmong teenager who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession - a 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: An exploration of human survival and the ability of fate to alter even the tidiest of lives with one major event, Cast Away tells the story of Chuck Noland (Tom Hanks), a Federal Express engineer who devotes most of his life to his troubleshooting job. His girlfriend Kelly (Helen Hunt) is often neglected by his dedication to work, and his compulsive personality suggests a conflicted man. But on Christmas Eve, Chuck proposes marriage to Kelly right before embarking on a large assignment. On the assignment, a plane crash strands Chuck on a remote island, and his fast-paced life is slowed to a crawl, as he is miles removed from any human contact. Finding solace only in a volleyball that he befriends, Chuck must now learn to endure the emotional and physical stress of his new life, unsure of when he may return to the civilization he knew before. Cast Away reunites star Hanks with director Robert Zemeckis, their first film together since 1994's Oscar-winning Forrest Gump(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: Two mismatched security guards are thrown together to bust a smuggling operation(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Jay Mohr and Lloyd Bridges (in his last role) star in this parody of the "Godfather" trilogy. The story centers on a powerful Mafia family, targeted by rivals who can't wait to see the aging Don (Bridges) and his potential successor out of the way of their glorious plans for the future of organized crime. Christina Applegate, Olympia Dukakis, Billy Burke, Pamela Gidley(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars in this energetic and influential story about a maverick cop's obsessive attempts to bring a cold-blooded serial killer to justice before he kills again(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: The director of the Academy Award-winning 2006 crime drama Tsotsi returns to the helm with this tale of a Middle East CIA operative who begins to have doubts about his latest assignment after witnessing the interrogation of a suspected suicide bomber by secret police. When Egyptian-born chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi (Omar Metwally) mysteriously vanishes on a routine flight from South Africa to Washington, his wife, Isabella (Reese Witherspoon), embarks on a frantic international search for her missing husband. At the same time, a CIA analyst (Jake Gyllenhaal) arrives at a clandestine detention facility outside of United States. As the interrogation of El-Ibrahimi gets under way, the CIA analyst is profoundly shaken by the unorthodox methods used by the man's captors, and quickly begins to reevaluate his assignment. Peter Sarsgaard, Meryl Streep, and Alan Arkin co-star in this topical political thriller penned by Kelley Sane and produced by Steve Golin(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: William The Exorcist Friedkin's horror film stars Ashley Judd as Agnes, a waitress in a run-down bar who lives in a cheap motel. Into her life comes drifter Peter who, having served in the Gulf war, is obsessed with the idea that he is infected by bugs implanted by the government during medical treatment. She begins to share his paranoia and the pair spiral into a violent conspiracy theory which sees them become violently delusional to the point of extreme self-harm as they battle the bugs they believe are within them. Based on Tracy Letts' play from Chicago's Steppenwolf theatre, this is a visceral, frightening film but one that maintains an empathy for its characters up to the apocalyptic finale(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: An ancient assassin attempts to trounce an evil conqueror by teaming up with a coalition of the remaining "free tribes" surviving under tyrannical rule(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: Medieval fantasy meets futuristic science fiction in this effects-heavy action epic from former X-Files director Rob Bowman. In present-day London, 12-year-old Quinn Abercromby witnesses the awakening of a hibernating dragon from a centuries-long slumber, the result of a construction dig supervised by his mother and an incident for which Quinn feels partially responsible. Twenty years later, the adult Quinn is the fire chief of a refortified castle community, responsible for dousing the blazes lit by the dragon's prodigious number of flame-spewing offspring, airborne juggernauts that have wreaked havoc across the globe, torching civilization and turning humans into an endangered species. Hope arrives in the form of Denton "Dragon Slayer" Van Zan, an American known to be the only man to ever kill one of the dragons, and Alex Jenson, a scientist/pilot who's a member of Van Zan's army, a zealous fighting force that includes a secret weapon: the Archangels, paratroopers using themselves as bait to attract and then dispatch the deadly beasts(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: As the end of the first Gulf War nears, a group of adventurous American soldiers attempt to find a huge cache of hidden Iraqi gold. Action(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: Comedian Cedric the Entertainer serves as both producer and star of this comedy about a family who discovers just how much can go wrong en route to a family get-together. When Nate Johnson (Cedric the Entertainer) is invited to a big family reunion in Missouri, he sees it as an opportunity to reconnect with his estranged wife and growing children, as well as a chance to show up his wealthier know-it-all brother, Mack (Steve Harvey). Nate takes delivery on an expensive new SUV, persuades his recently separated wife, Dorothy (Vanessa L. Williams), to tag along, and packs up his three kids -- nubile teenager Nikki (Solange Knowles), under-age wannabe rapper D.J. (Bow Wow), and precocious seven-year-old Destiny (Gabby Soleil) -- for what he imagines will be a leisurely drive from Los Angeles to St. Louis. However, between his wary wife, arguing kids, angry police officers, bizarre hitchhikers, bad diner food, and an unfortunate run-in with a cement mixer, getting from point A to point B proves to be just short of a nightmare. Johnson Family Vacation was the first feature film for director Christopher Erskin, who previously distinguished himself directing music videos for the likes of Missy Elliot, TLC, and Boyz II Men(n)

programme.title: Rock Star
programme.desc: Drama about a wannabe rock star who works by day as a copy machine repairman and by night as the lead singer of Blood Pollution, a Pennsylvania tribute band that imitates the heavy metal rockers Steel Dragon. He is devastated when his friends kick him out of the group he founded, but things begin to look up when he is tipped to replace the lead singer of his heavy metal idols. Based on the true story of rock band Judas Priest(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two ageing friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on holiday together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood resumes his role as uncompromising detective, 'Dirty' Harry Callahan in this third instalment of the Dirty Harry series. This time Callahan wages war on a terrorist group and his 'by the book' superiors(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic spanning a twenty-year period in the life of eccentric millionaire Howard Hughes, including the films, the women and his pioneering success as a world-class aviator. Visually stunning drama(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.title: Mercury Rising
programme.desc: An FBI agent tries to protect an autistic child from government operatives after the boy deciphers a national-security code(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: Denzel Washington plays a quadriplegic detective who tracks a serial killer from his home computer with the outside help of a gifted rookie cop(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: Screenwriter Randall Wallace, a specialist in sweeping historical epics, steps behind the camera for this fact-based Vietnam War drama that reunites him with his Braveheart (1995) star Mel Gibson. Gibson is Lt. Col. Hal Moore, commander of the First Battalion, Seventh Cavalry, the same regiment fatefully led by George Armstrong Custer. As part of the Pleiku Campaign of late 1965, Moore is assigned to an action at Landing Zone X-Ray in the Drang Valley, an area that would come to be known as the "The Valley of Death." Moore soon finds himself and his men contained to an area about the size of a football field, surrounded by more than 2,000 enemy troops and engaged in the first major battle of the war. Heroism becomes the order of the day as men like Moore, chopper pilot Bruce Crandall (Greg Kinnear), and Lt. Henry Herrick (Marc Blucas) refuse to yield, in spite of heavy losses of life. The film co-stars Madeleine Stowe, Chris Klein, Keri Russell, and Sam Elliott. We Were Soldiers is based on the book We Were Soldiers Once...and Young by Lt. Gen. Harold G. Moore (retired) and UPI reporter Joe Galloway (played in the film by Barry Pepper)(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Basketball coach Dan Haskins recruits a team of predominantly black players to play for his team in racially segregated and football-mad Texas. They must overcome the many challenges that face them if they are to prove victorious against Division I favourites Kentucky(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: When his young cousin is inadvertently charged with murder in an Alabama town, an untested Brooklyn lawyer takes on his first case as he attempts to defend two penniless youths in the heart of Dixie, where he clearly does not understand the protocols of the courtroom...or the South(n)

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: Romantic comedy. A middle-aged teacher and would-be writer takes his soon-to-be married friend on a week-long road trip through California's wine country. While meditating on friendship, love and regret, they meet two free-spirited local women who make them confront their futures(n)

programme.desc: Investigations into a stolen credit card lead Briscoe and Curtis to a pair of teenage lovers who may have killed their newborn son and disposed of the body. The couple strenuously deny any wrongdoing - but the discovery of a decomposing baby's finger adds weight to the evidence against them. Drama, starring Jerry Orbach.(n)

Rushing to the scene, they find a woman who has shot dead a man for attacking her husband - an incident that brings back painful memories for Stella, who once killed a boyfriend in self-defence.(n)

programme.desc: McCoy and Ross investigate when a restaurant becomes the scene of a shooting, and discover one of the diners is concealing a desire for revenge. Unfortunately, the object of their suspicion has a clever defence already up her sleeve - and only an expert witness can break her story. Sam Waterston and Carey Lowell star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate when a male nurse is found beaten to within an inch of his life - but as they draw closer to their prime suspects, the shocking motives for the attack become clear. Gritty police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill.(n)

programme.desc: Mac examines the death of a Base jumper seemingly killed when he hit a flock of pigeons, and discovers the victim was in a witness protection programme. Meanwhile, Stella looks into the case of a wealthy man found dead in his car on the day of his daughter's 16th birthday party - and Lindsay is bitten by a cobra at the scene of the crime. Drama, starring Gary Sinister and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A supposedly dead marine suddenly regains consciousness on the autopsy table, leaving the team struggling to solve the mystery of how he came to be in such a strange predicament. Investigations reveal he had recently been on a trip to Baghdad - and uncover an unexpected link to Gibbs' past. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is tipped off about terrorist activity, and two agents are murdered during the ensuing investigation. Believing the information to be a set-up, the team tries to solve the case with assistance from a guilt-stricken Paula Cassidy, who holds herself responsible for the tragedy. Drama, starring Jessica Steen.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: The team is tasked with tracking down the dealers of a drug linked to multiple overdoses. Tay and Burgess find a distraught child with a dark and twisted secret about his parents.(n)

programme.desc: A number of fertilised embryos are stolen from a sperm bank and the team's investigation reveals several unhappy customers - as well as a couple of outspoken anti-fertility activists who liken such clinics to death camps. Before long, Benson and Stabler have their suspects in custody - but a shocking turn of events at the courthouse turns the case into a murder. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson goes undercover in a prison to investigate a teenage girl's claims that a guard raped her and has been threatening her jailed mother. Posing as an inmate, she tries to find evidence that systematic abuse is taking place - and faces a terrifying ordeal in the basement of the facility. Starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.desc: Goren and Eames investigate the murder of a man who had been tried and acquitted of murdering his first wife 10 years before and went on to present a TV programme re-examining cases in which people had been wrongly accused by the police. They discover two friends were meant to have gone swimming with the victim at the time of his death, but had been tricked into staying away, and find themselves examining the past of ADA Mulrooney, whose career had been hampered by his involvement in the previous case.(n)

Meanwhile, Danny and Stella visit the home of a playboy bachelor who drowned in his indoor pool - and are surprised to learn he has a wedding-cake decoration lodged in his lung. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Flack looks into the death of a paintballer who was seemingly murdered when his killer swapped harmless ammunition for real bullets. The prime suspect turns out to be a rival who was competing with the victim for a sponsorship deal, but finding him is no easy matter. Meanwhile, Stella tells Mac she thinks she is being stalked. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinister, Eddie Cahill and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.desc: The fatal stabbing of a psychologist draws Briscoe and Curtis into a heated divorce case and pits McCoy and Ross against a manipulative attorney who puts results before professional ethics. Award-winning American police drama, starring Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.desc: McGee feels the pressure as the team investigates a double murder that appears to be inspired by his still unpublished new novel. American drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service, starring Sean Murray and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.desc: Director Jenny Shepard tries to solve the murder of an underworld source who was prepared to give information on the activities of arms dealer La Grenouille. Starring Lauren Holly and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.desc: Adam Sandler's second popular starring vehicle after Billy Madison is a goofy lowbrow paean to golf, hockey, and the comic hysterics of its childlike star. In Happy Gilmore, Sandler plays the title character, a raw, determined, but ultimately untalented hockey player who keeps trying out for the pros. When Happy discovers his grandmother (Frances Bay) will lose her home if she doesn't fork over 270,000 dollars to the IRS, he tries to figure out how he can possibly scrounge up the cash. An idea strikes during a game of one-upmanship with a couple furniture movers stripping his grandmother's home: On his first-ever swing, he drives a golf ball farther than the movers have ever seen. Before long, he has transplanted the foul-mouthed, aggressive persona of the hockey rink to the links, winning an amateur tourney that earns him a spot on the pro tour. Throttling everyone from a helpless caddy to game show host Bob Barker during the course of his 90-day quest to amass prize money, Happy also wins the sport a legion of new fans with his in-your-face style. Guiding him on his quest is a whimsical retired pro who lost his hand to an alligator (Carl Weathers) and an attractive public relations woman charmed by Happy's antics (Julie Bowen). Opposing him, however, is sneering hotshot Shooter McGavin (Christopher McDonald), who will do anything to win his championship jacket and see Happy fail(n)

When one of the men is threatened with court martial for his involvement in the death of 83 civilians, he calls on his former colleague, who is embittered by his Vietnam injuries, to act as his attorney. programme.title: Manhunter
programme.desc: This stylish psychological thriller was adapted by Michael Mann from the novel by Thomas Harris. Will Graham (William Petersen) is a burned-out FBI agent who retired after hunting and capturing Dr. Hannibal Lecter (Brian Cox), a psychopathic but brilliant serial killer. Will reluctantly returns to work to help find a new killer, who specializes in killing entire families. Will uses his empathic understanding of the motivations of the killers to help catch them, despite the psychological toll this takes upon him and his family. Brian Cox, in a great cameo as Hannibal Lektor, gives an interestingly physical and sexually menacing performance in a role which later won an Academy Award for Anthony Hopkins in Silence of the Lambs. Tom Noonan, in an interesting, psychologically complex performance, plays the killer whom he makes surprisingly understandable. Joan Allen is also fine as the blind woman whom the killer falls in love with. Their love scene -- as the killer experiences compassion and normal sexual attraction for the first time -- is outstanding and unforgettable. While it is overshadowed by the widely acclaimed Silence of the Lambs, Manhunter, based on the Thomas Harris novel Red Dragon holds its own as a suspenseful, psychological thriller directed with flair and style(n)

programme.desc: Bear Flood. An abnormally cold spring causes the Yukon River to flood. The people of Tanana prepare for the consequences, but are already on high alert after a black bear attack(n)

programme.title: The Last Alaskans: No Man's Land
programme.desc: Thieving Wolves. The Alaskans aren't the only ones in the wilderness hunting for game—the wolves are too. Normally, trap lines are a convenient way to catch multiple animals, but the wolves are using them as a buffet(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Levitating Lighthouse. A nautical-theme structure is built on the Pacific coast in Washington state to make a couple's dream of a seaside tree house come true, but Pete has his hands full with their requests for a rainwater shower system and composting toilet, and all the materials must be delivered to the location by barge(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Nelson Family Treehouse. In the Season 4 premiere, Pete presents a housewarming gift to his daughter and her boyfriend by disassembling a structure from the family's TreeHouse Point bed-and-breakfast(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Ultimate Treehouses V. Pete travels the globe to see some of the world's most impressive tree houses, including one shaped like a giant manta ray in Thailand and a spiritual getaway in the Australian wilderness(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Record High Recording Studio. Pete builds a high tech recording studio up in the trees. Upon completion, musician and megastar, CeeLo Green arrives to lay down a brand new track(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Scottish Sky Garden. Pete Nelson and his team design more private treetop escapes for those with a passion to reconnect with nature and awaken their inner child(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Magical Party Pad. Pete goes to Nebraska to build a tree house for a fun-loving family who enjoy music, writing and the occasional happy hour(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Magical Modern Treehouse. A modern marvel in Georgia features a 205-foot zip line. Also: Pete visits Dale Earnhardt Jr to check out his tree house(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Adventure Headquarters. A thrill-seeking couple want a headquarters for their adventures that sits 16 feet high in three cedars and features a wraparound deck for views from all sides(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Bon-Appé-Treehouse. A dining-room tree house is constructed in a large oak for a French restaurant that surrounded by fields of red poppies(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Frank Lloyd Lakehouse. A triple-decker structure with a nod to Frank Lloyd Wright is built in Kentucky on the shores of Lake Barkley that features a bedroom, kitchen and bathroom(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: How 'Bout Them Apples. Pete goes to Walden, N.Y., to construct an elevated tasting room for a hard-cider company that offers views of the surrounding apple orchard(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Zac Brown's Space Crab. Country star Zac Brown requests a tree house at a camp for kids in Georgia that looks like a cross between a spaceship and a horseshoe crab(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Swiss Family Surprise. A 40th anniversary present to a Michigan woman from her husband and son comes in the form of a tree house that features a kitchen, bathroom and loft, and, as a nod to the family's fondness for "The Swiss Family Robinson," a working waterwheel(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Nature's Super HQ. Pete goes to Michigan to build a multi-platform tree house on a nature preserve near Flint(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters: Out on a Limb
programme.desc: Surprise Makeover Edition. Pete surprises two lucky winners with complete, top-to-bottom, $20,000 renovations of their existing tree houses in the season finale(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.sub-title: A Treehouse Fit for a Viking
programme.desc: A Treehouse Fit for a Viking. Pete takes on his first international treehouse in Norway. Working alongside a local builder named Frode, the one-of-a-kind, 24-foot high retreat sleeps eight people and has a view of the nearby lake(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: A BBC wildlife cameraman arrives to film Longleat's fastest mammals, a vet is called out to one of the antelope and there is an update on Anne the former circus elephant.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts follow the fortunes of development projects run by parents and their children, reviewing the progress of their auction buys.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Aled Jones travels to Northern Ireland to meet a father and daughter who suffered loss in the 1998 Omagh bombing, and finds out how they can help a terror survivor.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: A woman who has switched from sugar to honey finds out whether it was such a good idea. Plus, how buttery does a product need to be to use the word `butter' in its name?.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and David Harper advise two teams competing at Newark Antiques and Collectors Fair, Nottinghamshire, while presenter Christina Trevanion visits Derby Silk Mill.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Brian waits to hear the outcome of his trial, while Conor tries to shake Rachel out from under the crooked cop's spell. Sharon must do battle once more.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Retired friends Terry and Andy from Somerset bid to crack the three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright hosts, with help from Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple plan to spend £750,000 on a home in South Devon large enough to accommodate their library of more than 3,000 books, and Margherita Taylor visits Agatha Christie's home.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: A collection of some of the best, unseen finds from the series, visiting the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, and the RAF museum in Hendon, London.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Thief Trackers
programme.desc: The team uses GPS to follow a criminal who steals a camera and passes it to an accomplice. Casualty actor Tom Chambers hopes tracking technology will help find his stolen motorbike, and in the Shropshire market town of Ludlow, a thief leaves a very distinctive footprint.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney is overjoyed when Woody turns up, but still finds time for old friend Lauren, who confides in her about Steven. Ted makes plan for his wedding anniversary party at the Vic but is taken back by Fi's prices. The police go to arrest Karen for stealing Arthur's Bench. Will Keanu own up to it being him?.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: John Sweeney investigates what is going on at the top of the charity, following the chief executive's sudden resignation in June. John meets people who accuse the RSPCA of being heavy handed by prosecuting them and taking away their animals when help or advice would have been more appropriate, and meets former senior insiders, who have concerns about the charity's governing council.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney and Woody celebrate their engagement with a party in the Vic - but how will Mick feel about having Woody back in the pub? Keanu discovers whether he will be getting a full-time job at the end of his apprenticeship.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Emma Willis is the latest to take part in the popular genealogy documentary, in which famous faces trace their family trees. The TV presenter, who considers herself a true Brummie, is keen to learn more about her family in Birmingham, tracing back to Victorian times and her hard-working ancestor James Gretton, a local merchant. The Big Brother host then learns that her father's grandmother was born in Ireland. Surprised to hear of this new line of ancestry, Emma heads across to Dublin to find out more - but she is disturbed by what she learns.(n)

programme.title: Kicked Out: From Care to Chaos
programme.desc: Film-maker Rebecca Southworth sets out to find out why so many children in care go on to lead troubled lives. It's a deeply personal subject for Rebecca, who was abused by her father as a child and taken into the care of social services. She may have bucked the trend thanks to a stable foster home, but here she aims to find out why so many others seem to end up leading such chaotic lives.(n)

programme.title: Queer Britain
programme.desc: New series. Journalist Riyadh Khalaf, who was raised as a Catholic with a Muslim father, focuses on religion in this series shining a light on gay culture.(n)

programme.title: Queer Britain
programme.sub-title: The Search for the Perfect Body.
programme.desc: Riyadh Khalaf looks at body image pressures in the gay community, examining body dysmorphic disorder and eating disorders. He also strips off himself for a naked photo shoot.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: The penguin keepers embark on their most ambitious project to date, building an underwater feeding machine, while a hyrax is rushed to the vet for some emergency dental work.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a cliff-side house in Devon, a bijou London property and former police cells in the Kent town of Ramsgate, before they are sold at auction. The pair then find out about the new owners' plans for their purchases and check on their progress at a later date.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Aled Jones meets a man whose furniture business was razed during the 2011 London riots and a woman who was a member of the so-called `broom army'. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Amid complaints of rising prices, Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon, and Julia Somerville set out to reveal the true cost of Britain's fish and chips. Plus, the benefits given by supermarkets to dairy farmers and the foreign-sounding lagers that actually have their origins closer to home than most people imagine.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from the market town of Newark, Nottinghamshire, as experts Philip Serrell and Charles Hanson help two teams scour an antiques fair seeking items to sell for profit at auction. Plus, Charlie finds out more about the extraordinary story of TE Lawrence, better known as Lawrence of Arabia.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Feelings run high on the day of Brian's trial, Paudge regrets abetting a thug, while a drained Rachel is feeling the pressure.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: With a top budget of £560,000, Jules Hudson assists a retired couple in their bid to move to Cornwall, where they hope to get involved in the local community.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Adam Partridge and Caroline Hawley uncover a few gems at Muncaster Castle in Cumbria, including a silver candlestick and some Coalbrookedale plates. Presenter Paul Martin delves into the Lake District's bobbin industry.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the opening night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, which will include the men's 10,000m final, as well as the opening round of heats in the men's 100m and women's 1500m. Great Britain's Mo Farah is expected to compete in the men's 10,000m as he attempts to add to the tally of gold medals he has claimed in this event at both the 2012 and 2016 Olympic Games, and the 2015 World Championships. Meanwhile, his compatriot Laura Muir will look to continue the incredible form that saw her win double gold in the 1500m and 3,000m at the European Indoor Championships earlier this year, while the biggest star in athletics, Usain Bolt, will begin his quest for gold in his final appearance at this Championships. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson, Denise Lewis and Paula Radcliffe, and commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter, Steve Backley and Toni Minichello. Coverage continues on BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee faces a parenting dilemma as he worries that son Charlie is getting a reputation at school for being the class clown. But is it a simple case of the old adage `like father, like son'? Sally Bretton co-stars, alongside Hugh Dennis and Selina Griffiths.(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: An embittered lawyer decides to relive the wild, crazy days of his youth after his girlfriend is unfaithful, and enlists the help of two equally disillusioned friends in setting up a fraternity house next to his former college campus. Comedy, starring Luke Wilson, Will Ferrell, Vince Vaughn and Juliette Lewis.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Richard Ridings to pick the TV shows that shaped his life, including the physical comedy of Harry Worth and the inspiration he gained from watching Oliver Reed.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Keepers are taken by surprise with the unexpected birth of a sea lion pup, while one of the park's best known giraffes has become very sick, and vets cannot work out why.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw presents from the Westpoint Arena in Exeter as experts Gary Pe and Charlie Ross help two teams to try make a profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Museum of the Year
programme.desc: Tristram Hunt, the newly appointed director of the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, presents coverage of Art Fund's 2017 Museum of the Year ceremony. This year, the finalists are London's Tate Modern and John Soane Museum, the Newmarket Heritage Centre for Horseracing and Sporting Art, Birmingham's Lapworth Museum of Geology, and the Hepworth art gallery in Wakefield. In 2016, the V&A claimed the coveted award, and here, Tristram seeks tips and advice on maintaining its lofty reputation from those responsible for running the museums up for recognition this year.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Tommy Banks, Josh Overington and Danny Parker continue the battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's North East final.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman continues his history of the First World War. He looks at how Britain edged closer to defeat in the worst conflict it had ever known and Germany's attempt to starve the country into submission, which led to rationing, prompting the publication of the Win-the-War Cookery Book. Anyone found hoarding food was put on trial as newspapers exposed how the rich dined out on lobsters in London's Mayfair. Meanwhile, a film of fighting in the trenches broke box-office records - but what effect did it have on the British public's desire for peace?.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner explore the cuisine and culture of Devon, beginning in Dartmouth, where a third-generation fisherman talks about the history of crab cocktails. Brian also visits Riverford Organics where he creates a beetroot and pepper tart Tatin.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces BBC archive recipes featuring unusual combinations, including Nigel Slater's cheesy apple pie, and Rachel Khoo's figs and chicken livers.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of leopards and their cubs in East Africa. While other big cats such as tigers, cheetahs and lions struggle to survive, leopards thrive across half the world and even manage to live undercover in farms and cities in Africa and Asia. Jonathan Scott narrates.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: With the drought biting hard, food is in short supply and intrepid monkeys invade the family's safari camp, while lack of water means Saba Douglas-Hamilton is struggling to give her guests the experience they expect. Frank and David set off on a dangerous mission to help the biggest bull elephant in northern Kenya.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the world of rodents, whose constantly growing incisor teeth are used to chisel through any obstacle and range from squirrels and the English harvest mouse to the large South American capybara. He looks at examples of their dental prowess, showing how agoutis in Panama break open rock-hard nutshells and the skills employed by beavers in Wyoming as they fell massive trees to build dams rivalling feats of human engineering.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Chenies Manor, near Amersham in Buckinghamshire, where members of the public bring along treasured antiques and collectibles. A young woman chooses a 21st birthday present from a collection of pocket watches kept in a biscuit tin and a train set that has been in its box for 70 years finally sees the light of day. Fiona reads a letter from a soldier to be opened in the event of his death, the relatives of a glassblower pay a moving tribute to their father's work and the update feature focuses on an ornate French plant stand first seen on the show in 1991.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show in which pairs of contestants go head to head attempting to crack a series of passwords, in a bid to win £2,500.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents a look ahead to the event, which takes place at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, and is due to commence tomorrow night. Usain Bolt and Mo Farah are both expected to appear at these championships for the final time in their respective careers, with Bolt due to retire later this year, and Farah intending to concentrate on running marathons after the Diamond League event in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: 10 Puppies and Us
programme.desc: Documentary following young dogs and their new owners over the course of their all-important first six months together. Telephone psychic Delia is keen on the idea of a big-breed dog to join her in her London flat, so canine behaviourist Louise Glazebrook arranges for her to try before she buys. Cocker spaniel Poppy joins the Vaughan family in leafy Surrey, where she gets the undivided attention of the children. However, three-year-old Isadora is a little too eager to play, even when the pooch wants to rest, and when Poppy bites back, Louise arrives with some advice on puppies and young children.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.sub-title: Top of the Lake: China Girl: The Loved One.
programme.desc: As the investigation continues, the autopsy reveals more that expected about the victim known only as China Girl. Realising she was a sex worker, Robin and Miranda do the rounds of Sydney's brothels - only for a startling revelation to send the case in a new direction. Meanwhile, Robin contacts her daughter's adoptive parents Julia and Pyke, who agree to a meeting. But things do not go well when the detective clashes with Julia. Elizabeth Moss, Nicole Kidman and Gwendoline Christie star.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Women's British Open
programme.sub-title: Golf: Women's British Open Highlights: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the opening day of the event, which this year is staged at Kingsbarns Golf Links in Fife. The course is hosting the prestigious tournament for the first time in its history, and is expected to include a stellar line-up of competitors among the field of 144 entrants.(n)

programme.title: Birds of Paradise: The Ultimate Quest
programme.desc: Part two of two. Explorer Benedict Allen is determined to get disabled journalist Frank Gardner into the wilds of Papua New Guinea, despite having to grapple with Frank's wheelchair. As the terrain gets even tougher to negotiate, the pair know they must make an epic journey into the highlands, crossing through two tribal territories to achieve their objective. However, as Frank gets close to realising his dream of seeing wild birds of paradise up-close, his old injuries return to haunt him and the expedition hangs on a knife edge.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Over the past two years, the staff of the Natural History Museum has undertaken a super-sized challenge - to take down its famous cast of a dinosaur skeleton in the entrance hall and replace it with an equally impressive skeleton of a blue whale - the largest animal to have lived. This documentary follows the teams of conservators and engineers as they take apart the diplodocus - known to staff and visitors as Dippy - bone by bone, ready for a countrywide tour and then get the whale ready to go on display - all without closing the museum to the public. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Tudor Treat.
programme.desc: Four modern confectioners relive the world of historical sweets, making treats that have not been tasted in centuries from original recipes. The first episode focuses on the Tudor era, where the team makes candied roses and roots, sugar plates and goblets and a model banqueting house, while historians Annie Gray and Emma Dabiri reveal how sweets were a sign of wealth, but were made possible through the slave trade.(n)

programme.title: Mini Monet Millionaire
programme.desc: Martin Shaw narrates a profile of 14-year-old painter Kieron Williamson, who held his first show at the age of six and is already worth £2,000,000. With access to the Williamson household, this film follows Kieron's preparations for a major exhibition, revealing how his career is managed by his parents. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Richard Ridings to pick the TV shows that shaped his life, including the physical comedy of Harry Worth and the inspiration he gained from watching Oliver Reed.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: A BBC wildlife cameraman arrives to film Longleat's fastest mammals, a vet is called out to one of the antelope and there is an update on Anne the former circus elephant.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and David Harper advise two teams competing at Newark Antiques and Collectors Fair, Nottinghamshire, while presenter Christina Trevanion visits Derby Silk Mill.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits a floral paradise outside of Dublin and discovers how Jimi Blake fills his garden with flora for free. Elsewhere, Nicky Bailey demonstrates how to transform a bland patio into a space that looks incredible at twilight, and Mark Lane travels to Oldham to visit the newly opened Maggie's Centre.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman concludes his history of the First World War, focusing on the final 12 months of the conflict, when the country came close to defeat. He reveals how grieving parents held seances in the hope of contacting their dead sons and surgeons battled to rebuild the faces of the wounded, and tells the story of a maverick MP who tried to blame the crisis on a conspiracy of sexual deviants in government. Eventually, the tide of battle turned and the armistice was signed, leaving an exhausted nation counting the cost of four years of war. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents a quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner visit Suffolk, where they pick fruit for the chef to turn into a gooseberry and ginger biscuit fool, and go crabbing in Orford. Later, they meet some Suffolk punch horses, and chef Madalene Bonvini-Hamel creates a pork platter. Plus, how to cook a roast crown of chicken with a wholemeal pancake stack.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of dishes using game. The menu includes a venison dish from Rachel Khoo, Keith Floyd cooking with pheasant recipe, Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry's raised game pie, Raymond Blanc cooking with pigeon, and a rabbit dish from Nigel Slater.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Forest Elephants: Rumbles in the Jungle.
programme.desc: Scientist Andrea Turkalo examines the social bonds formed by elephants deep in the rainforests of central Africa. After more than 20 years of field study, she has begun to unravel the secrets of the animals' lives and the meanings of the sounds they use to communicate with each other. Richard Armitage narrates.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The family and the camp team celebrate the end of the tourist season, Samburu style. Sabu watches over the elephant mothers as they are about to give birth, while Frank and David try to safeguard the future of Samburu's wildlife.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the hunting tactics of the world's carnivores. Arctic foxes in the frozen north must collect food during warmer times to survive the winter, while the big cats of the southern hemisphere rely on stealth and surprise to catch each meal. The presenter also reveals how leopards and tigers are solitary hunters, coming together only to mate, whereas lions stay in family groups so they can tackle larger prey and better protect their young.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Women's British Open
programme.sub-title: Golf: Women's British Open Highlights: 2017 Day Two.
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the second day of the event, which this year is staged at Kingsbarns Golf Links in Fife. Reigning champion Ariya Jutanugarn was expected to appear at this year's tournament, alongside the likes of Inbee Park, Yani Tseng, Michelle Wie, and British hopefuls Catriona Matthew - who triumphed in 2009 - and Charley Hull, and today was the day in which all players in the field were attempting to make the cut.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the opening ceremony at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, which famously staged the 2012 Olympic Games, and will play host to 10 days of competition in a multitude of track and field events featuring the best athletes in the world. Coverage continues on BBC One.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Prog rocker Rick Wakeman and actor friend Ian Lavender embark on the cross-country treasure-hunting challenge around Norfolk, joined by experts Raj Bisram and David Harper. While Rick uncovers hidden medieval graffiti in Norwich Cathedral, Ian examines the world's largest collection of model soldiers in north Norfolk. But which of the stars will make the most money at auction in Nottingham?.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the celebrated quiz as more contenders brave the infamous black chair. The specialist subjects in the first round are the four gospels, Margaret Atwood's MaddAddam trilogy, flags of the world and the colour films of Danny Kaye. As usual, the second round consists of general knowledge questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: A team of geocachers takes on a trio with an interest in Vikings in the quiz testing general knowledge and lateral thinking. The players must make connections between four things that may at first not appear to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of exhibit, salt and pepper, outcast and roots manoeuvre. Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don plants up a new bed of irises and takes pelargonium cuttings. Nick Bailey brightens up a dull and shady space at the side of a terraced house and gives advice on plants that will thrive. Carol Klein pays the first of two visits to West Yorkshire to meet a couple whose outstanding planting has resulted in a garden full of late summer interest, while Joe Swift takes a look at a sloping and shady town garden to find out how the owner has designed this difficult space. Plus, the Dorset gardener who has created an Italianate idyll, and an in-depth look at the pelargonium. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: 2017 Day One Review.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents reaction to and analysis of the opening night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, as Paula Radcliffe, Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson offer their input.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by James O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: The Help
programme.desc: An aspiring journalist returns to her Mississippi home in the 1960s and begins documenting the lives of black servants working for wealthy white families. Her project brings the community's household staff together, but creates controversy among their employers. Drama based on Kathryn Stockett's novel, starring Emma Stone, Viola Davis, Bryce Dallas Howard and an Oscar-winning Octavia Spencer.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Peter Powell and Gary Davies present the April 4 show, featuring the Special AKA, Thomson Twins, Blancmange, Queen, Nik Kershaw, OMD and Kool and the Gang.(n)

programme.title: Shipwrecks: Britain's Sunken History
programme.desc: Maritime historian Dr Sam Willis travels to Africa to trace the origins and development of the `women and children first' protocol when abandoning ship - a code of conduct that came about in the Victorian era. He also reveals how the period oversaw trials of several other proposed solutions to high mortality rates at sea, such as life jackets, lifeboats, and rockets that could fire rescue lines on board stricken vessels. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Prejudice and Pride: The People's History of LGBTQ Britain
programme.desc: The second of two documentaries in which people share the items that have defined their lives in the 50 years since homosexuality was partially decriminalised in 1967. Focusing on the past 30 years, it features the nun-impersonating freedom-fighting Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence, the writer behind a famous lesbian kiss and a Muslim man who set up an LGBTQ support group for South East Asians. Presented by Susan Calman and Stephen K Amos.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: Bobby is a swaggering man about town. But Bobby has a secret. Monologue, starring Gemma Whelan. Written by Jackie Whelan.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: Steve, a groom-to-be, anxiously prepares his wedding speech. However, as the big day arrives, he has to consider what has been won and what has been lost. Monologue written by Gareth McLean and delivered by Alan Cumming. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: How to Be a Lady - An Elegant History.
programme.desc: Rachel Johnson embarks on a quest to find out how to be a lady. The writer and former editor of the Lady magazine explores the origins of the word `lady', from the time when it represented a specific code of behaviour, dress and speech, to the current day, asking why terms such as `ladylike' remain in use. As part of her mission, Rachel rides side-saddle, attends an etiquette school and visits her grandmother's own Ladies' College at Cheltenham.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Peter Powell and Gary Davies present the April 4 show, featuring the Special AKA, Thomson Twins, Blancmange, Queen, Nik Kershaw, OMD and Kool and the Gang.(n)

programme.title: King Alfred and the Anglo-Saxons
programme.sub-title: Aethelstan - The First King of England.
programme.desc: Michael Wood explores the role of Alfred the Great's grandson Aethelstan in creating a kingdom of all England. The presenter travels to Devon, Cumbria, Scotland and Rome to reveal why he believes the English monarch was one of the greatest, and tells the tale of the ruler's learning and law-making, including his development of a national coinage and his defeat of the Vikings and Scots in the Anglo-Saxon Great War. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Shipwrecks: Britain's Sunken History
programme.desc: Maritime historian Dr Sam Willis travels to Africa to trace the origins and development of the `women and children first' protocol when abandoning ship - a code of conduct that came about in the Victorian era. He also reveals how the period oversaw trials of several other proposed solutions to high mortality rates at sea, such as life jackets, lifeboats, and rockets that could fire rescue lines on board stricken vessels. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Prejudice and Pride: The People's History of LGBTQ Britain
programme.desc: The second of two documentaries in which people share the items that have defined their lives in the 50 years since homosexuality was partially decriminalised in 1967. Presented by Susan Calman and Stephen K Amos.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Janice Long introduce performances by Sandie Shaw and the Smiths, Phil Collins, Belle and the Devotions, Bob Marley and the Wailers, Duran Duran, Julio Iglesias and Willie Nelson, Echo and the Bunnymen, the Flying Pickets and Lionel Richie.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: At London's Royal Albert Hall, YolanDa Brown introduces a tribute to jazz greats Ella Fitzgerald and Dizzy Gillespie, in the centenary year of their births. Grammy Award-winning singer Dianne Reeves and trumpeter James Morrison perform with the BBC Concert Orchestra under the baton of John Mauceri, as they showcase some of the music most closely associated with the duo.(n)

programme.title: Reginald D Hunter's Songs of the South
programme.desc: The comedian concludes his road trip through the American South by exploring the musical heritage of Mississippi and Louisiana. In Memphis, he meets songwriting partners Steve Cropper and Eddie Floyd at Stax Records, before going on the trail of the origins of both delta and hill country blues in the company of musicians Seasick Steve and Cedric Burnside. His final port of call is New Orleans, where he meets Dr John, Irma Thomas and Allen Toussaint, three of the city's most celebrated artists. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Oh! You Pretty Things: The Story of Music and Fashion
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne narrates this three-part documentary exploring the influence of musicians and designers on the coolest and craziest looks in Britain, and how fans emulated their idols. The first programme focuses on the golden years of the 1960s, when Mod legends the Small Faces became the best dressed band in England and the Beatles and the Rolling Stones embraced psychedelia.(n)

programme.title: Sex and the City 2
programme.desc: What happens after you say, "I do?" It's been two years since Carrie Bradshaw and Big (Chris Noth) tied the knot. Now, somewhere between wild passion and a baby, they're feeling a little too much like "Mr. and Mrs. Married!" So when Carrie and her archetypal galpals take off on an all-expenses week in Abu Dhabi, they soon discover how much fun "forbidden" can be! Halfway across the world, she stumbles upon long-lost love Aidan (John Corbett), and even though she's convinced it means something, the girls think she's playing with fire. Sarah Jessica Parker, Kim Cattrall, Kristin Davis, Cynthia Nixon and (all of) their men reunite with series executive producer Michael Patrick King in this follow-up to the $400+ million global box-office smash comedy about fashion, fun and friendship! Starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Kim Cattrall, Kristin Davis, Cynthia Nixon(n)

programme.title: NCIS

Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Marine gunnery sergeant Wendell Dobbs is gunned down in a drive-by shooting by assailants wielding AK-47s, and the team suspects the victim may have been involved in illegally importing automatic weapons into the country and supplying them to local gangs. Sam goes undercover to find the truth after learning Dobbs gave up his combat post to mentor his younger brother, who had been hanging out with a gang. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)
