programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Part two of two. The group embarks on a road trip in an attempt to help Grace forget about Leo, but Jack and Karen soon get bored with the car journey. Jack spots a man whose face he remembers from an old TV advert, and makes him a tempting offer.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Queens for a Day - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Will offers to cook Thanksgiving dinner when Vince's mother injures her leg, but soon realises it is more trouble than it is worth. Meanwhile, Jack gives advice to Ro, who feels unable to tell her family and fiance she is gay. American sitcom, guest starring Jamie-Lynn DiScala (The Sopranos).(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie is thrilled to learn that Robert's new girlfriend is a virgin, so Ray tries to convince her that Debra is a `good girl' too, leading to a surprising revelation from Marie and Frank.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra gets involved in a heated dispute with another parent at Ally's little league baseball match, but Ray fails to take her side because he is afraid of making himself unpopular. Dan Castellaneta, better known as the voice of Homer Simpson, guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Show Where Sam Shows Up.
programme.desc: Cheers owner Sam Malone turns up in Seattle to ask for advice on whether to go through with his wedding - but Frasier recognises his old friend's fiancee as a woman he slept with three months previously. Comedy, guest starring Ted Danson and Tea Leoni.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink casually wanders into Daphne's bedroom, making her furious with him. He apologises, but inadvertently does it again and she threatens to leave, forcing him to shower her with gifts to make her stay. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Crane brothers are both invited to join a prestigious gentlemen's club - but unfortunately there is only a single vacancy available, meaning one of them is destined for disappointment. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: John Wilson, the President and Chief Operating Officer of Rollins Incorporated - the parent company of eight pest-control firms including flagship brand Orkin - goes undercover. He poses as a contestant on a reality TV competition who is trying to win money for his own business, and works alongside his employees to make sure the organisation is heading for another century of keeping homes rodent-free.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart attends a rock concert with Milhouse, so Marge and Homer buy him a guitar to encourage his musical interests - but it is Otto who ends up calling the tune. Featuring the voices of Spinal Tap members Michael McKean and Christopher Guest.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Career aptitude tests have an unexpected effect on the Simpson kids, prompting Lisa to fall in with a bad crowd while perennial troublemaker Bart finds a new respect for law and order.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from in and around Rugby, Warwickshire, compete in the challenge. Laid-back estate agent Michael and his partner Caroline cook a fine dining menu, but party queens Soroya and Jodie aren't impressed with the main. Expectations are high that Freddie and Raj will produce a fantastic menu, but Michael and Caroline are looking for cracks in their perfect relationship. On the final night, Soroya and Jodie are determined to show their guests what they're all about - but things fail to go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An Ibiza club DJ plans to take her act beyond the shores of the party island, but needs funds to push herself into the global limelight, and hopes the sale of her designer goods will give her the money she needs to achieve her ambition. Enter handbag specialist Claudia, James Constantinou's fiancee, who offers the customer a big surprise. Meanwhile, Alicja gets excited when she claps eyes on a vintage gold and diamond timepiece, and Prestige boss James hopes to recoup his losses when an unredeemed Aston Martin goes to auction.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Kate Humble in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Luke continues to cause confrontation among the group, while another one of the jurors just cannot wait to leave.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A Redditch couple want to spend some time in the sun now their four children have grown up, so Laura Hamilton helps them search for an apartment in the Spanish town of Torrevieja.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Denmark v Austria.
programme.desc: Denmark v Austria (Kick-off 5.00pm). Coverage of the opening semi-final, held at the Rat Verlegh Stadion in Breda, the Netherlands. The team to emerge victorious from this match will progress to the final, which is due to take place on Sunday. Channel 4 News is on More4 tonight.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Netherlands v England.
programme.desc: Netherlands v England (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the second-semi-final, held at De Grolsch Veste in Enschede, the Netherlands. England boast a 100 per cent record so far from their group games against Scotland, Spain and Portugal and quarter-final against France, and are aiming to reach the final for the first time. However, they face a tough task against the hosts who, despite lacking pedigree in the women's game going into the tournament, also qualified from their group with three wins out of three, and eliminated Sweden in the last eight. Subsequent programmes are subject to change.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and David O'Doherty compete against Jon Richardson and Natasia Demetriou. John Kearns joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Trying to prove the authenticity of the internet's most famous clips, including a futuristic head shave, the world's most idiotic selfie and a city in the sky. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The dads are under the spotlight at Liverpool Women's Hospital as three very different men prepare for fatherhood. Midwife Kirsty looks after Rebecca and Jack, a soldier who's more confident about going into battle than he is about changing nappies. Mum Billie arrives with her ex-partner Nathan, and although they're apart, they hope they can raise their child together. Cameras also follow John, who has always wanted to be a dad. He hopes some of his broodiness will rub off on girlfriend Natalie.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Part one of two. For six weeks, 10 four year olds will share their classroom with 11 pensioners. In an experiment led by three geriatric specialists, the young and older group follow the same timetable in a new nursery set within a retirement village near Bristol. The senior group will undergo tests to measure mood, memory and mobility during their daily interaction with the kids.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre ER
programme.desc: Cases include a man who fell off a ladder and landed on his dad and the woman who could not walk after slipping on a crisp packet. Last in the series. Previously shown on E4.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Kevin and Natalie discover their beloved six-year-old German shepherd has a tumour. In desperation, they turn to Noel Fitzpatrick in the hope he can find a way to prolong Otto's life until their wedding day. The team also sees Jane, Simon and their Rottweiler puppy Elvis, who is having trouble walking, and seven-week-old Pomeranian Gucci, brought in with a broken paw by Amber and her two children after only 48 hours in her new home.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined by First Dates love ambassador Fred Sirieix, food critic Jay Rayner, deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put fish pie, lager and smoked bacon to the test. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test this time is for garlic bread.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of house-hunters. In North Yorkshire, they catch up with Trudi and Steve who relocated from Edinburgh to be nearer their relatives, and in Luton, Bedfordshire, the experts find out whether community artist Zena has been able to move out of her parents' home and get onto the property ladder.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three rival sellers in Redditch, Worcestershire, compete to sell their homes to buyer Joe, an interior designer, after snooping round each other's abodes and spending £1,000 making improvements. The host meets mother and daughter Jackie and Sarah, who need to update their kitchen, Angela and Nick, who look to change their dark dining room furniture, and business owner Jane, joined by her daughter Kerry, who transform the ground floor of her modern townhouse.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Kate Humble in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Queens for a Day - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Thanksgiving celebrations continue, but head chef Will feels unappreciated, and tries to persuade Jack to stop Ro revealing her sexual orientation at the dinner table. Meanwhile, Grace and Karen both take a shine to Vince's much younger brother. American sitcom, starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen offends her stepdaughter, Olivia, during a shared Christmas break. Meanwhile, Grace attends a seasonal party at Will's mother's house, but accidentally breaks a treasured figurine and tries to blame another guest. Starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert's traffic-school students complain they are fed up with his class, so he resorts to teaching them using a puppet - an innovation that proves far from boring. American comedy, starring Brad Garrett and Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: A discovery makes Ray worry about his mortality - and prompts him to compile a list of things he wants to do before he dies. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink worries he is being stalked by an unbalanced fan after receiving strange gifts with seemingly threatening messages attached. In an effort to thwart any assassination attempt he hires a female bodyguard to protect him at an awards ceremony. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Worried that Martin has never expressed his love for them, Frasier and Niles join their father on a fishing trip in the hope that they can bond with him. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A caller to his radio show gives Frasier the impression Niles's wife Maris might be having an affair with her fencing instructor. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: President of Moe's Southwest Grill, Paul Damico, goes undercover to check the standards he values are still being met. The company is one of the world's fastest growing restaurant chains with 10,000 employees and Paul wants to look for opportunities to assist his staff in a similar way to how his family were helped by his father's bosses during his childhood.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Convinced the family no longer loves him, a dejected Santa's Little Helper decides to run away from home, and has the misfortune to be adopted by Mr Burns - who brainwashes him into becoming a vicious attack dog.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer goes to a Country and Western bar after a row with Marge, and vows to make the venue's singing waitress a star. As he throws himself into the role of manager, he realises he has to choose between his new career and his loyalty to his family. Featuring the voice of Beverly D'Angelo.(n)

programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Colin and Mandy kick proceedings off in Bristol with a colourful and spicy assortment of courses, while their guests are treated to a night of conversation about romantic meetings, outrageous shirts and naked gardening. Next, PJ and Owen defy expectations and create a fancy menu, but their purple potato mash is more like play-doh, while Geoff and Gemma round things off with a hearty and rich selection of courses. Who will secure the £1000 prize?.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An international deal for James Constantinou on a wine collection in Lanzarote may be worth a million Euros, and a couple look to sell their one-of-a-kind house boat. Elsewhere, a gastro pub owner wants to take a loan out against a £250,000 Bentley, and James considers a risky deal on an unusual giant gemstone. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Countdown

programme.title: The Question Jury

It is the last chance for this group of jurors to win up to £10,000. However, a misunderstanding causes them to question who each can trust.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After 30 years of marriage and a life dedicated to their family, Simon and Mary Loyne feel the time has arrived to focus on themselves. They have sold their Cheshire home and cannot wait to move to Spain's Costa Almeria. Danni Menzies shows them five fabulous properties for their budget of £100,000, but do they go for a townhouse with a man cave Simon really wants or an apartment close to the beach, in Mary's perfect location?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In central Scotland, bakery assistant Jennifer hopes her night of hearty home cookery and cookie decorating will impress. She is joined by music producer Rory, operations manager Darren and drama coach Linsay. Night two sees Rory attempt to win over the crowd with his Swedish inspired grub and next up stylish Darren wows his guests. Linsay finishes the week with a trip to `retroville', but can she keep her bodily functions to herself?.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Holiday Resort
programme.desc: Cameras monitor life at the all-inclusive Holiday World Resort in Malaga on Spain's Costa del Sol to take a warm-hearted look at what Britons get up in the sun and what it takes to keep them happy. Those featured include the Lloyd family from Northampton, including 12-year-old Danny whose singing and dancing proves a hit at the aquafit class. The Wades from Southend-on-Sea, Essex, are hoping to bond via the resort's all-inclusive entertainment - provided the children stop bickering, while James and Leanne from Preston battle the crowds during the morning stampede for the pool.(n)

It remains to be seen who is playing up for the benefit of the viewing public and who is taking a more laid-back approach to their public incarceration.(n)

She is keen to leave behind her childlike persona for which she has become known, but to do this she must confront her demons, touching on her battles with anorexia and depression, and the time she was admitted to a psychiatric unit at an early age.(n)

programme.desc: Cambridge art historian Paul Binski explores approaches to religious architecture, comparing Canterbury Cathedral's 12th-century stained-glass windows with those of York Minster, which were created only 100 years later, yet reflect a very different view of man's relationship with God.(n)

programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the opening day's play in the final Test of the four-match series, which took place at Old Trafford in Manchester.(n)

programme.desc: Iain Lee narrates a compilation of clips of young hounds doing the cutest and funniest things. Plus, a look behind the scenes at the internet's best canine supervirals. Contribitors include Dave Spikey, Zoe Lyons and Des Clarke.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: A chance to catch up with the latest events inside the house as the celebrities cope with living under constant surveillance, with all the arguments and alliances, as well as the revelations in the diary room.(n)

programme.title: Autopsy: Kurt Cobain
programme.desc: In April 1994, 27-year-old musician and Nirvana frontman Kurt Cobain was found dead at his Seattle mansion with a gunshot wound to his head. A suicide note was found at the scene and police quickly concluded that Kurt had taken his own life. In the years since controversy has raged over the nature of his death, with many claiming he had too much heroin in his system to have shot himself. Here, forensic pathologist Dr Jason Payne-James examines all the available medical evidence and with testimony from family and friends, finally hopes to reveal the real cause of Kurt Cobain's death.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the CBB companion show, including celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments and behind-the-scenes insights.(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer stars as John Holmes, legendary porn star of huge talent but who, in the 80s, was out of films and into drugs. He falls in with gangster Eddie Nash (Eric Bogosian) who believes Holmes told a bunch of drugs dealers about his wealth and robbed him. Four are found beaten to death, the survivor incriminates Holmes but at trial, he's acquitted, although ex-wife Lisa Kudrow isn't so sure. James Cox's film, told in different time frames and almost from a Rashomon point of view, is a glimpse of the Los Angeles nightmare, where not everybody is a tooth-whitened Hollywood star(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: A lab-created human/alien hybrid goes on a killing spree while searching for a man who can impregnate her. Meanwhile, the scientist responsible for her creation brings together a motley crew in order to stop her(n)

programme.title: Bride of Chucky
programme.desc: The homicidal doll from the "Child's Play" series is brought back to life by his human ex-girlfriend (Jennifer Tilly), who becomes a doll herself. Reunited, the two set out in search of a magical talisman that will return them to human form, venting their murderous urges along the way. Alexis Arquette, John Ritter, Katherine Heigl, Nick Stabile(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: When meek Eilis Lacey (Saoirse Ronan) emigrates from Ireland to New York City, her heart is soon torn between a magnetic Italian neighbor (Emory Cohen) and a charming lad (Domhnall Gleeson) back home(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: In Gary Winick's romantic comedy, Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway star as best friends competing to nab the same location for their wedding reception. When Liv and Emma were girls they attended such an impressive wedding at New York's landmark Plaza Hotel that they swore that, when the time came, they would each celebrate their nuptials there. Twenty years later, after saying 'yes' to their respective fiancés, they've instructed their wedding planner to book the ceremony of their dreams. But because of a clerical error they're both given the same slot - and neither is willing to concede. Instead, their friendship is jettisoned as they resort to underhand tactics in a bid to sabotage each other and fulfil their marriage fantasies... Also starring Candice Bergen, Chris Pratt and Bryan Greenberg(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula and Ian are parents to a teenage daughter in this sequel that brings the entire Portokalos family together for another huge wedding(n)

programme.title: The Color of Money
programme.desc: A pool hustler mentors a talented young player and his street-smart girlfriend, but his attempts to corrupt the young man make him reassess his own decisions in life(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Sugar
programme.desc: Filmmakers Ryan Fleck and Anna Boden (Half Nelson) weave this introspective sports drama concerning a talented Dominican baseball player who longs to break into the American big league and earn the money needed to support his impoverished family. Miguel Santos is a talented pitcher who might just have what it takes to earn a prized spot on a Major League Baseball team, but before that happens he'll have to prove his worth in the minor leagues. Advancing into the United States' minor league system at the tender age of 19, Miguel is warmly welcomed into the small-town Iowa home of his host family, but can't help but struggle with language and cultural barriers despite the kindness of strangers. Subsequently forced to reevaluate his life's ambition after his once-trusty arm becomes unreliable, the previously single-minded pitcher gradually begins to question both the world he lives in and the role he has chosen to play in it(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: (2010) Michael Cera (Juno, Superbad) stars in this unconventionally structured, inventive and comic paean to the alternate universe of manga and computer gaming. The movie is based on an acclaimed series of graphic novels by Canadian cartoonist Bryan Lee O'Malley, and is directed by British film-maker Edgar Wright (Shaun of the Dead, Channel 4's TV series Spaced), here making his Hollywood debut. Computer game fanatic Scott Pilgrim (Cera) is the bass player with Toronto band Sex Bob-omb. He shares his flat with his slightly-out-of-control gay friend Wallace Wells (Kieran Culkin), and courts a little controversy by dating 17-year-old schoolgirl Knives Chau (Ellen Wong). However, theirs is a fairly platonic relationship, and one he's prepared to ditch the moment he sets eyes on the woman (literally) of his dreams: Ramona Flowers (Mary Elizabeth Winstead). But if Scott wants to capture the impossibly cool New Yorker's heart, he must first defeat her former lovers, the Seven Evil Exes, in video game end-level-style combat. So he embarks on a kinetic, romantic quest, largely conducted within his own head, replete with slapstick violence, impressive effects and witty retorts(n)

programme.title: As Above, So Below
programme.desc: A group of young people uncover a disturbing secret when they venture into the catacombs below Paris(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its oppressive faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey outside of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Adventurer Rick O'Connell and his new wife Evelyn return to battle the nefarious undead Imhotep and his beautiful but ruthless sidekick, who have kidnapped their son and taken him to Egypt. However, neither party is expecting to come face to face with another seemingly invincible evil force(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: The Mariner (Kevin Costner) tries to rescue Enola (Tina Majorino) after she's captured by Deacon (Dennis Hopper)(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Robert Aldrich's tense and exciting thriller about air crash survivors who are finally forced to try and build a single-engine aircraft from the wreckage of their plane in order to escape from their crash-site in the north African desert(n)

programme.title: Ugly
programme.desc: A smart but lonely outsider looks for love in the wrong place. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: Thomas, Teresa, and the rest of the Gladers prepare for phase two of their maze trials after narrowly escaping the first test in this young-adult dystopian sequel(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Eerie saga about a rare-book buyer who becomes a target of unknown forces when he's asked to find a volume about the Devil(n)

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In this horror sequel, a game of Ouija leads to supernatural activity. The youngest daughter of a widow is possessed by an evil spirit as the family goes through hell to try desperately to save her(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: An exploration of human survival and the ability of fate to alter even the tidiest of lives with one major event, Cast Away tells the story of Chuck Noland (Tom Hanks), a Federal Express engineer who devotes most of his life to his troubleshooting job. His girlfriend Kelly (Helen Hunt) is often neglected by his dedication to work, and his compulsive personality suggests a conflicted man. But on Christmas Eve, Chuck proposes marriage to Kelly right before embarking on a large assignment. On the assignment, a plane crash strands Chuck on a remote island, and his fast-paced life is slowed to a crawl, as he is miles removed from any human contact. Finding solace only in a volleyball that he befriends, Chuck must now learn to endure the emotional and physical stress of his new life, unsure of when he may return to the civilization he knew before. Cast Away reunites star Hanks with director Robert Zemeckis, their first film together since 1994's Oscar-winning Forrest Gump(n)

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: A betrayed mob hit man goes the lam with his son, and seeks revenge against vicious gangsters. As the bullets start to fly, the impressionable child is exposed to the goriest aspects of his father's talents in this gorgeously stylized action thriller(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.title: Incarnate

Warcraft
programme.desc: Humans and orcs clash in this film adaptation of the popular video-game series(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore, Cameron Diaz, and Lucy Liu return alongside director McG for the sequel Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle. In this adventure, the Angels are assigned by Charlie to track down a pair of missing rings encoded with the names of every federal witness in the government's protection and relocation program. The women employ all of the skills seen in the first film in order to stop the bad guys (and bad girls). Bill Murray declined to appear in the sequel. The role of Bosley has been taken over by Bernie Mac. Demi Moore rounds out the cast of this big-budget spectacle(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer stars as John Holmes, legendary porn star of huge talent but who, in the 80s, was out of films and into drugs. He falls in with gangster Eddie Nash (Eric Bogosian) who believes Holmes told a bunch of drugs dealers about his wealth and robbed him. Four are found beaten to death, the survivor incriminates Holmes but at trial, he's acquitted, although ex-wife Lisa Kudrow isn't so sure. James Cox's film, told in different time frames and almost from a Rashomon point of view, is a glimpse of the Los Angeles nightmare, where not everybody is a tooth-whitened Hollywood star(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: A lab-created human/alien hybrid goes on a killing spree while searching for a man who can impregnate her. Meanwhile, the scientist responsible for her creation brings together a motley crew in order to stop her(n)

programme.title: Bride of Chucky
programme.desc: The homicidal doll from the "Child's Play" series is brought back to life by his human ex-girlfriend (Jennifer Tilly), who becomes a doll herself. Reunited, the two set out in search of a magical talisman that will return them to human form, venting their murderous urges along the way. Alexis Arquette, John Ritter, Katherine Heigl, Nick Stabile(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: When meek Eilis Lacey (Saoirse Ronan) emigrates from Ireland to New York City, her heart is soon torn between a magnetic Italian neighbor (Emory Cohen) and a charming lad (Domhnall Gleeson) back home(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: In Gary Winick's romantic comedy, Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway star as best friends competing to nab the same location for their wedding reception. When Liv and Emma were girls they attended such an impressive wedding at New York's landmark Plaza Hotel that they swore that, when the time came, they would each celebrate their nuptials there. Twenty years later, after saying 'yes' to their respective fiancés, they've instructed their wedding planner to book the ceremony of their dreams. But because of a clerical error they're both given the same slot - and neither is willing to concede. Instead, their friendship is jettisoned as they resort to underhand tactics in a bid to sabotage each other and fulfil their marriage fantasies... Also starring Candice Bergen, Chris Pratt and Bryan Greenberg(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula and Ian are parents to a teenage daughter in this sequel that brings the entire Portokalos family together for another huge wedding(n)

programme.title: The Color of Money
programme.desc: A pool hustler mentors a talented young player and his street-smart girlfriend, but his attempts to corrupt the young man make him reassess his own decisions in life(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Sugar
programme.desc: Filmmakers Ryan Fleck and Anna Boden (Half Nelson) weave this introspective sports drama concerning a talented Dominican baseball player who longs to break into the American big league and earn the money needed to support his impoverished family. Miguel Santos is a talented pitcher who might just have what it takes to earn a prized spot on a Major League Baseball team, but before that happens he'll have to prove his worth in the minor leagues. Advancing into the United States' minor league system at the tender age of 19, Miguel is warmly welcomed into the small-town Iowa home of his host family, but can't help but struggle with language and cultural barriers despite the kindness of strangers. Subsequently forced to reevaluate his life's ambition after his once-trusty arm becomes unreliable, the previously single-minded pitcher gradually begins to question both the world he lives in and the role he has chosen to play in it(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: (2010) Michael Cera (Juno, Superbad) stars in this unconventionally structured, inventive and comic paean to the alternate universe of manga and computer gaming. The movie is based on an acclaimed series of graphic novels by Canadian cartoonist Bryan Lee O'Malley, and is directed by British film-maker Edgar Wright (Shaun of the Dead, Channel 4's TV series Spaced), here making his Hollywood debut. Computer game fanatic Scott Pilgrim (Cera) is the bass player with Toronto band Sex Bob-omb. He shares his flat with his slightly-out-of-control gay friend Wallace Wells (Kieran Culkin), and courts a little controversy by dating 17-year-old schoolgirl Knives Chau (Ellen Wong). However, theirs is a fairly platonic relationship, and one he's prepared to ditch the moment he sets eyes on the woman (literally) of his dreams: Ramona Flowers (Mary Elizabeth Winstead). But if Scott wants to capture the impossibly cool New Yorker's heart, he must first defeat her former lovers, the Seven Evil Exes, in video game end-level-style combat. So he embarks on a kinetic, romantic quest, largely conducted within his own head, replete with slapstick violence, impressive effects and witty retorts(n)

programme.title: As Above, So Below
programme.desc: A group of young people uncover a disturbing secret when they venture into the catacombs below Paris(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its oppressive faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey outside of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Adventurer Rick O'Connell and his new wife Evelyn return to battle the nefarious undead Imhotep and his beautiful but ruthless sidekick, who have kidnapped their son and taken him to Egypt. However, neither party is expecting to come face to face with another seemingly invincible evil force(n)

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In this horror sequel, a game of Ouija leads to supernatural activity. The youngest daughter of a widow is possessed by an evil spirit as the family goes through hell to try desperately to save her(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: An exploration of human survival and the ability of fate to alter even the tidiest of lives with one major event, Cast Away tells the story of Chuck Noland (Tom Hanks), a Federal Express engineer who devotes most of his life to his troubleshooting job. His girlfriend Kelly (Helen Hunt) is often neglected by his dedication to work, and his compulsive personality suggests a conflicted man. But on Christmas Eve, Chuck proposes marriage to Kelly right before embarking on a large assignment. On the assignment, a plane crash strands Chuck on a remote island, and his fast-paced life is slowed to a crawl, as he is miles removed from any human contact. Finding solace only in a volleyball that he befriends, Chuck must now learn to endure the emotional and physical stress of his new life, unsure of when he may return to the civilization he knew before. Cast Away reunites star Hanks with director Robert Zemeckis, their first film together since 1994's Oscar-winning Forrest Gump(n)

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: A betrayed mob hit man goes the lam with his son, and seeks revenge against vicious gangsters. As the bullets start to fly, the impressionable child is exposed to the goriest aspects of his father's talents in this gorgeously stylized action thriller(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

But even though he has a watertight alibi and the team move on to further leads, Poole can't shake the notion that his old adversary is somehow involved. programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: Documentary following palaeontologists searching for dinosaur fossils. A team of scientists searches for the skull bones of what may be a brand new species of horned dinosaurs.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor teams up with Captain Taco Perez at Fort Lauderdale in Florida to catch a sailfish, but his expedition proves less than successful. However, his efforts finally pay off in Miami, where he finally manages to land the fish with the help of a local man with 30 years' experience. Later he heads inland to the lakes and creeks of Gemini Springs to try his hand at bowfishing from a flat-bottomed airboat, and visits the West Palm Beach Fishing Club to hunt for the bull shark - an aggressive predator that has been known to attack humans.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at the animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: A team of marine experts reveal the hidden stories of our planet's last true wilderness - its oceans. Here, they investigate how the predatory Humboldt squid is invading the sea.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: A team searches a 100-year-old dig site to find the remains of a 73-million-year-old armoured dinosaur, while a paleontologist couple tries to airlift a 4,000kg skeleton.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor heads to California on the final leg of his seven-month adventure. He teams up with a guide for a fly-fishing experience at Mission Bay in San Diego, but instead of catching the trout to which Robson is accustomed, the duo go after blue sharks. He later returns to the location and succeeds in a night-time mission to land the giant Humboldt squid, but the following day spent on the Salton Sea lake proves less fruitful. He concludes his world tour by crossing the state line into Arizona, where he journeys down the Colorado River in search of rainbow trout.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough concludes the documentary series by focusing on the world's deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.(n)

He concludes his world tour by crossing the state line into Arizona, where he journeys down the Colorado River in search of rainbow trout.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: A team searches a 100-year-old dig site to find the remains of a 73-million-year-old armoured dinosaur, while a paleontologist couple tries to airlift a 4,000kg skeleton.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough concludes the documentary series by focusing on the world's deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.(n)

programme.desc: A team of marine experts reveal the hidden stories of our planet's last true wilderness - its oceans. Here, they investigate how the predatory Humboldt squid is invading the sea.(n)

programme.desc: Looking at Mangroves, salt-water tolerant shrubs which are home to numerous different creatures, including sea horses and tree crabs.(n)

programme.title: Planet Ice

programme.desc: The civilian crew of a drilling station are called in to save sailors in a nuclear submarine stuck on the seabed of the Atlantic. But they aren't the only ones interested in the lost sub. Deep sea chiller(n)

programme.title: Meet Wally Sparks
programme.desc: Disgustingly obnoxious talk-show host Wally Sparks - amid pressure from his host network to clean up his act - becomes embroiled in a scandal involving doctored photos of a Southern governor in a rather compromising situation. Rodney Dangerfield, Debi Mazar, Cindy Williams, Burt Reynolds, David Ogden Stiers, Alan Rachins(n)

programme.title: Get Shorty
programme.desc: John Travolta stars in Barry Sonnenfeld's brilliant film of Elmore Leonard's comedy of manners as a debt collector for the Mob who winds up in Los Angeles where he discovers his skills are just those required of a movie producer. With Gene Hackman, Danny DeVito, Dennis Farina(n)

programme.title: Concussion
programme.desc: This sports-drama centers on the research conducted by forensic neuropathologist that raised public awareness about Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy resulting from such high-impact sports as professional football(n)

programme.title: Eragon
programme.desc: Stefen Fangmeier's action-packed fantasy film is set in a medieval-like society ruled by the despotic Galbatorix, abetted by his henchman Durza. Galbatorix has exterminated the fabled Dragon Riders who threatened his reign but a teenage boy, Eragon, discovers a surviving egg from which hatches the dragon Saphira. Unable to control her as she grows, Eragon finds guidance from village layabout Brom, who reveals himself to be the last of the Dragon Riders. The three raise a rebel army to topple Galbatorix but at the same time, Eragon and Saphira must rescue princess Arya from Galbatorix's evil clutches(n)

programme.title: Flicka
programme.desc: A headstrong teenager clashes with her father over her desire to tame a wild mustang in this sentimental update of Mary O'Hara's classic novel "My Friend Flicka"(n)

programme.title: The Original Kings of Comedy
programme.desc: Comedians Steve Harvey, D.L. Hughley, Cedric the Entertainer and Bernie Mac bring down the house in this outrageous concert film. Director Spike Lee captures the geniuses behind the "Kings of Comedy" tour as they perform in Charlotte, N.C. in February 2000(n)

programme.title: A View to a Kill
programme.desc: MI6 agent James Bond's latest mission is to foil the evil plan of technology mogul Max Zorin, who wants to cause an earthquake that will wipe out his competitors in Silicon Valley. Action(n)

programme.title: Shattered
programme.desc: This homage to Hitchcock opens with a man waking from a terrible accident. With his memory gone and his body shattered, he has to rely on his wife to help him reconstruct the past. But as the pieces come together, he realises that things might not have been as rosy before the accident as his wife had suggested. Doubtful of his own identity, he searches for someone who can help him find the truth(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: Mel Brooks directs the cream of the Eighties comedy crop, including John Candy and Rick Moranis, in this hysterical parody of Star Wars. The Schwartz is most definitely with this one(n)

programme.title: You Only Live Twice
programme.desc: When agent James Bond 007 is sent to investigate the disappearance of an American spacecraft, he discovers Blofeld, a megalomaniac bent on starting World War III. Operating from a spectacular base built into a volcano, Blofeld's radar-proof spacecraft has swallowed up American and Russian spaceships with the intention of causing the superpowers to blame each other and declare war(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: How to Build a Brand. Following Reggie and Missy's advice, Cam pays a visit to a dying, basketball-loving teen who hits him with a surprise request; Reggie suggests that Cam to put the family on the payroll(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: The Decisions. Missy works to score Reggie a membership in an exclusive country club that was founded by blacks, while Cam, in his search to support a church, gets a surprise from a pastor(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Guy
programme.desc: A successful lobbyist jumps into a new relationship shortly after breaking up with her noncommittal boyfriend. But when her ex resurfaces she soon realises that one of the two men is not who he appears to be(n)

programme.title: The Accused
programme.desc: A rape victim's lawyer must prosecute the assilants who try and turn the case around(n)

programme.title: The Hitcher
programme.desc: Remake of the 1986 chiller about a couple who pick up a psychopathic hitchhiker(n)

programme.title: PCU
programme.desc: Actor Hart Bochner turns director in the satirical Animal House update P.C.U.. Per the title, the film takes place on the campus of a University where, thanks to militant dean Jessica Walter, Political Correctness has reached ridiculous proportions. A group of dorm-room cutups, wallowing in their uncorrectness, declares war on the uptight student activists who call the shots. Saturday Night Live's David Spade is among the leading players; while he's funnier here than in his costarring stints in Chris Farley's films, he doesn't have much to work with. The subject matter covered in P.C.U. has already been tackled, with far funnier results, on Bill Maher's cable-TV weekly Politically Incorrect(n)

programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic sci-fi tale about two ordinary Midwesterners who are transformed by extraordinary chance meetings with visitors from outer space. Vilmos Zsigmond won an Oscar for his dazzling cinematography(n)

programme.desc: Shirley MacLaine and Debra Winger lead an all-star cast in James L. Brook's Oscar winning drama as a mother and daughter who find out just how difficult love can be(n)

programme.desc: Porter Stoddard has never cheated, never even looked at another woman. Well, maybe once. But when family friend Mona sees her husband with another gal, Porter comforts her and it ends in bed. Woody Allen-style marital comedy drama(n)

programme.desc: Spy thriller charting the life of the man charged with heading the CIA's covert operations and uncovering a mole during the Bay of Pigs scandal, revealing how he changed from a once idealistic student into the untrusting overlord of American espionage(n)

programme.desc: Investigating the deaths of three British agents, 007 encounters Mr. Big and Dr. Kananga, leaders of a vast crime network(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: Out of the Past. Cam and Reggie reconnect with a talented player whose career was sidetracked by prison; Cassie gets a home-purchasing budget from Reggie; and Cam contemplates slipping into a shoe-endorsement deal(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: Six. In the Season 1 finale, a former girlfriend reconnects with Reggie, leaving the family concerned(n)

programme.title: Top Secret!
programme.desc: An American rock and roll singer becomes involved in a Resistance plot to rescue a scientist imprisoned in East Germany(n)

programme.title: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in coexistence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade. Now, three teens (Nicholas Braun, Josh Fadem, and Mackenzie Davis) must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace their town previously held. Robbie Pickering directs this horror comedy(n)

programme.title: Grindhouse
programme.desc: In a throwback to 1970s exploitation films and drive-in double features, directors Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez serve up a chilling two-fer with "Death Proof" and "Planet Terror." The first is about a killer car; the second's a zombie flick. In the opener, Kurt Russell plays a stuntman wreaking havoc with his wheels of death. Then, survivors of a bio-weapon mishap battle an army of killer zombies. Rose McGowan has roles in both. Tarantino and Rodriguez also scripted their films(n)

programme.title: The Island
programme.desc: Michael Caine stars in this Michael Ritchie thriller as Maynard, a newspaper reporter who embarks on a search to discover the mystery of the Bermuda Triangle and becomes a prisoner of a primitive island tribe(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's terrifying masterpiece about a coastal community plagued by a killer shark. With the summer tourist season at hand, the mayor is keen to keep the first attack hushed up. But when an expert claims that the attacks are the work of a giant Great White, there is only one solution - to kill the monster fish before it can feed again. Based on Peter Benchley's best-seller, three sequels and numerous imitators followed(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: A retired Special Forces colonel storms the South American stronghold of terrorists who have kidnapped his daughter to blackmail him into deposing a Latin dictator(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: Charlie Croker, fresh out of prison, takes on a job to steal gold from Italy. In order to finance the raid he enlists the help of Mr Bridger, an established criminal. The team plans to distract the Italian police with a traffic jam whilst they make off with the bullion in three Mini Coopers..(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's terrifying masterpiece about a coastal community plagued by a killer shark. With the summer tourist season at hand, the mayor is keen to keep the first attack hushed up. But when an expert claims that the attacks are the work of a giant Great White, there is only one solution - to kill the monster fish before it can feed again. Based on Peter Benchley's best-seller, three sequels and numerous imitators followed(n)

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: In this sci-fi/horror scarefest, Dr. William Weir (Sam Neill) is a scientist who has designed a spacecraft called Event Horizon which will explore the outer reaches of space past the planet Neptune; the ship employs a special transport mechanism that, in effect, creates a black hole that the ship can pass through, allowing it to travel tremendous distances in a few seconds. The Event Horizon mysteriously disappears in the midst of a mission with no trace of either the ship or its crew, but it reappears in Neptune's orbit after a seven year absence and it's sending out a distress signal. The spaceship Lewis and Clark, and Dr. Weir, are sent to investigate; the crew -- Captain Miller (Laurence Fishburne), pilot Smith (Sean Pertwee), engineer Justin (Jack Noseworthy), navigator Starck (Joely Richardson), physician D.J. (Jason Isaacs), and emergency technicians Peters (Kathleen Quinlan) and Cooper (Richard T. Jones) -- are already tired and unenthusiastic about this assignment, and somewhat confused by Weir's reports. The crew of the Lewis and Clark are convinced that Weir is not telling them something, and when they discover the Event Horizon, they find that things are not what they seem, and an evil presence has taken over the ship. Incidentally, the term "event horizon" describes the outer boundaries of a black hole(n)

programme.title: Red State
programme.desc: Kevin Smith steps his foot into horror territory with this politically tinged fright flick about a controversial Fred Phelps-ish reverend who brings his own brand of zealotry to a wayward group of teens(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: Critically acclaimed director David Gordon Green takes a break from the brooding drama that defined such early efforts as George Washington and Undertow for this action-flavored buddy comedy concerning two pot-smoking friends (Seth Rogen and James Franco) who unwittingly become involved with a vicious gang of drug dealers. Judd Apatow and Shauna Robertson produce a script co-penned by star Rogen and Evan Goldberg(n)

programme.title: Impostor
programme.desc: This long-delayed science fiction thriller from director Gary Fleder was actually filmed prior to his box-office hit Don't Say a Word (2001), which preceded it in theaters by several months. Based on a 1953 short story by Philip K. Dick, the film shares that schizophrenic author's long-running obsessions with concealed identity and humanity's potential inferiority to alternative life forms. Gary Sinise stars as Spencer John Olham, a respected government scientist in the year 2079 trying to devise a secret weapon that will help his fellow humans win a decade-long war with invading aliens that are cloning human subjects and using the replicas as walking time bombs. Suddenly, Olham is accused of being an alien spy and a nationwide manhunt to capture him ensues. With even his doctor wife (Madeleine Stowe) unsure that she can trust him, Olham must uncover the truth on his own, even as he's relentlessly pursued by Hathaway (Vincent D'Onofrio), a federal agent charged with destroying the clones. Imposter has a complicated history, originally produced in early 2000 as a 30-minute short to be included in an anthology entitled "The Light Years Trilogy," a project that never got off the ground. So impressed was Dimension Films with the completed piece, however, that the footage was incorporated into a new feature version. That film was then shuffled around the release schedule for more than a year as effects were completed, reshoots were ordered, and the film was recut for a PG-13 rating instead of its original R. The R-rated "director's cut" was later released on DVD(n)

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: Coastal resort-town police chief Brody (Roy Scheider) has reason to believe that a dangerous white shark is in the vicinity, and he wants the beaches closed. As in the original Jaws, the town council is more concerned with tourism than with the possibility of death and mayhem, which is exactly what results when they refuse to close the beaches. Unable to find a worthy shark hunter, Brody is forced to take on the nemesis himself in a thrilling finale in which nearly the entire waterfront is destroyed(n)

While the Jackal starts to plan his audacious assassination, determined to pick off his target at the Liberation Day celebrations, French security forces learn of the plot and assign a senior detective to stop him(n)

programme.desc: Salma Hayek and Penélope Cruz star in this ripping Comedy-Western about two Mexican beauties who become outlaws to avenge the deaths of their fathers, who were murdered by a ruthless robber baron (Dwight Yoakam). Sam Shepard and Steve Zahn costar as members of their gang. Directed by Joachim Roenning and Espen Sandberg. Filmmaker Luc Besson co-wrote the script with Robert Mark Kamen. Denis Arndt, Audra Blaser, Karl Braun, Ismael Carlo, Carlos Cervantes(n)

programme.title: Kill the Irishman
programme.desc: Based on author Rick Porrello's book To Kill the Irishman: The War that Crippled the Mafia, director Jonathan Hensleigh's richly detailed biopic details the rise and fall of notorious Cleveland union rep Danny Greene (Ray Stevenson), who earned notoriety in the mid-'70s for his bold willingness to defy the Italian mob. Raised on the mean streets of Cleveland, Greene's tough reputation eventually lands him a contact with the local mob. Before long, the scrappy local has become a mafia enforcer, but after forming an alliance with notorious gangster John Nardi (Vincent D'Onofrio) and burning feared loan shark Shondor Birns (Christopher Walken), Greene starts to discover that he has the potential to become as powerful as any of his adversaries. Later, Greene develops a reputation as untouchable after surviving numerous assassination attempts, and dealing a devastating blow to organized-crime syndicates across the U.S(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Candidate - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Private investigator Adrian Monk, whose obsessive-compulsive disorder enables him to focus on minor details and solve even the most baffling of cases, agrees to help the police catch would-be assassin of mayoral candidate Warren St Claire. Detective drama, starring Tony Shalhoub, Bitty Schram and Ted Levine.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: When Detective Sanchez's brother is murdered in a drive-by shooting, Brenda and the team try to discover who is responsible - while preventing their colleague from exacting personal revenge. However, the investigation is compromised when residents of the area where the crime was committed refuse to co-operate.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a hairdresser and discovers a history of domestic violence. Meanwhile, Brenda's parents visit, but annoy her by spending much of the trip asking about her marriage plans. Starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs throws himself back into his work following his near-death experience, updating his appearance and tackling a new risky case alongside DEA agent Luis Mitchell, who wants help bringing down a drugs cartel. Concerned about his colleague's apparent enthusiasm to re-enter the field, DiNozzo discovers Mitchell is the son of a former NCIS agent who gave his life trying to save Gibbs' late wife and daughter, and this attachment is causing Gibbs to break his own rule against personal involvement in a case. However, a significant danger is posed by Benson Long, the cartel's head, and Mitchell's top target.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine is found murdered in Quantico, mere hours after calling Gibbs to discuss a possible case. In response, Bishop and McGee go undercover as a married couple to run surveillance on a lieutenant and his wife, who may be connected to the death. Starring Mark Harmon, Emily Wickersham and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Candidate - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The investigator looks into the murder of the mayoral candidate's bodyguard, and discovers the real identity of the intended target. Further analysis reveals how the case intertwines with the death of Nicole Vasques. Starring Tony Shalhoub, Bitty Schram and Ted Levine.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Bogus psychic Dolly Flint, who has been arrested three times by Stottlemeyer on fraud charges, helps Adrian stage a fraudulent seance with the aim of catching the killer of a former police commissioner's wife. Tony Shalhoub stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Two police officers are killed in Mexico, and evidence suggests the prime suspect is an FBI informant, but with corruption rife among the force in Tijuana, Brenda does not know who to trust. Starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Members of the squad realise a teenager who was recently killed by his own pipe bomb was not working alone. As they race against the clock to prevent a massacre, they risk paying the ultimate price for their work. Starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A young Navy Seaman is found dead, with his eyes gouged out, after being involved in a car accident. Starring Mark Harmon and Rocky Carroll.(n)

programme.desc: Peter and his friends take a stand against their wives by going on a road trip to the Deep South, but their antics along the way land them in jail. Meanwhile, Lois and the girls remain in Quahog, engaging in some childish shenanigans.(n)

programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten cooks for a friend and makes roasted pea soup, red pepper and goat's cheese sandwiches, with carrot and pineapple cake for dessert.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten holds a party for the team who helped create her dream barn, and makes smoked salmon with herbed butter.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares two lunches, with recipes including warm duck salad and blueberry crumb cake.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten cooks a lunch of swordfish steaks in tomato caper sauce, saffron and courgette couscous followed by individual chocolate puddings.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates a selection of recipes which can be made in advance, including a roasted vegetable lasange with four cheeses.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: A selection of cheese recipes, including a cheddar beer soup, and a giant ricotti and spinach ravioli with sage butter.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: As head of the fashion design agency Judy Inc., David Clemmer falls short in the taste department. Ezra and Julie dress up the agency's menu repertoire with easy, no-cook recipes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree makes spicy jerk chicken and a crunchy corn salad.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree makes a basic chicken salad with grapes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree makes hearty rib-eye quesadillas and spicy perfect pinto beans.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree celebrates her dad's retirement with a meal of all his favourite foods, including slow-cooked burgundy beef stew and mini chocolate-cherry cakes.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: To celebrate the 100th birthday of world-famous children's author Roald Dahl, four bakers compete to have their cake at the centre of the party.(n)

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.sub-title: From The Garden To The Sea And Back To Mum's Kitchen.
programme.desc: Jono calls on Antony to help him build a funky glass house, and Poh cooks the boys lunch and goes fishing.(n)

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh and Sara develop three unique ice cream flavours, and back home, Poh whips up a batch of butter chicken and leaves it on the doorstep of her neighbour.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The four winning chefs prepare to serve their dishes to an expectant audience of wartime heroes at the banquet at St Paul's Cathedral commemorating the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. They get a nasty shock when they first arrive at the venue and discover the kitchens aren't quite up to the highest standards, but judges Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort help rectify the situation - although the delay forces one of the chefs to work long into the night.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: As the guys are away, Ree Drummond makes a blueberry crumb cake for breakfast, and petite filets with wasabi cilantro cream, lobster mac and cheese and lemony broccolini for dinner.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree cooks up a celebration dinner for her husband's birthday, with chili cheese burgers, crisp thin fries, a wedge salad and a yellow cake with a chocolate buttercream frosting.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers battle to have their amazing creations as the centrepiece of the Addams Family party, but only one will take home the $10,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: Spin-off from the cookery competition featuring young contestants.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman searches for London's hidden delights, including a sundae you can only buy if you dance first and a speakeasy disguised as a detective agency.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman heads to Argentina, where he samples French toast from a steampunk speakeasy, an off-menu Mendozan stew served in a pumpkin, and lamb loin from a secret restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef uses home-grown produce from his Essex garden to create interesting variations for pizza toppings, including a calzone and a quattro gusti cooked in his traditional wood oven for an authentic rustic taste.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger meets chef Johnny Hernandez in San Antonio and cooks regional Mexican dishes.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking is makes his way through Texas for live-fire Latin American cooking and to savour the flavours of smoked European-style sausages.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Actress Sienna Miller shares her recipe for Tuscan duck ragu, Jamie Oliver cooks a whole salmon in salt and Jimmy Doherty creates a DIY hog roast for the ultimate crackling. Jimmy and Jamie also try to revive the fortunes of the little-known tosset cake, a biscuit associated with the village of Stalmine in Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: When Joe and Gene opened Somers 202 it was popular among locals. However after being open for four years the business has not been as successful and Willie Degel steps in.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Cara is concerned about unhealthy competition between her two New Orleans restaurants, Toast and Tartine. The Mystery Diners go undercover and make a surprising discovery.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Kristy and Sarah from Moviesets in New Orleans are concerned about theft at their event centre. Mystery Diners Rob and Ingrid book a wedding reception and make a discovery.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Tom makes a shocking proposition to the ailing Diana, while Jane seeks advice on becoming a nun and Geoffrey poses as a Hell's Angel in a misguided effort to impress his estranged wife Marion. Comedy, starring Graham Crowden, Stephanie Cole and Janine Duvitski.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Harvey decides that if Diana and Tom are seen to be mentally incompetent it will give him power of attorney over their affairs and end all his woes. However, the couple are wise to him, and plan a well-orchestrated display for the visiting psychiatrist. Comedy, with Graham Crowden, Stephanie Cole and Daniel Hill.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin has trouble sleeping and seems too tense - even by the standards that normally apply to him. Aware that Paul knows some relaxation techniques, Anne asks her neighbour for help. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Helen is relieved that Gordon is busy preparing for Elderly Week at the centre, as it will keep him away from the birth of their twins. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly and Clegg are enlightened in the wisdom of the East by an electrical handyman from Hull, and Howard struggles to keep his self-styled bandit persona alive. Meanwhile, a debt-collector is an unwelcome guest for Tom.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Pick-Up of the Later Ming Dynasty.
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg.
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles

programme.desc: Helen is relieved that Gordon is busy preparing for Elderly Week at the centre, as it will keep him away from the birth of their twins. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: A journalist writes a story about Tom and Barbara's way of life and Jerry and Margo try to exploit the Goods' new celebrity status for different reasons. Comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Richard Briers, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. Comedy with the wheeler-dealing Trotter family, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Geraldine tries to make the supreme sacrifice by giving up chocolate for Lent. Mrs Cropley's also being good, vowing to steer clear of lard and fishpaste pancakes, and even Jim has a bash at self-denial. Meanwhile, Alice's unwavering belief in the Dibley Bunny is ridiculed. Easter special from 1996.(n)

programme.desc: Comedy highlights, courtesy of the frantic funnyman with the fez, featuring his unique style of magical illusion.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Obnoxious louts Richie and Eddie manage to become trapped on a fairground ride, unaware it is due for demolition the following morning. Comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.desc: Bryn is in his element as he awaits the arrival of the Essex boys, who are having a big night out in Cardiff and staying for a sleepover, but Smithy is concerned about seeing Nessa again after their last meeting. Meanwhile, Stacey tells Gavin about a worrying discovery, and Pam and Mick discuss their plans for a new conservatory.(n)

programme.sub-title: Rhod Gilbert, Jon Richardson and Kerry Godliman.

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy runs out of money and descends into a world of hunger, homelessness and criminality. Meanwhile, Mark needs to find himself a girlfriend before his birthday party. Award-winning comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The pals look forward to celebrating Christmas, but an unexpected guest disrupts their plans as Richie suffers delusions of grandeur and the whole spirit of the festive season is jeopardised. Anarchic comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Feature-length Christmas special from 2001. A veteran actress is shot through the heart during the filming of a darkly surreal love story, but the bullet appears to have passed through a plate-glass window without breaking it. With Maddy out of the country, Jonathan is lumbered with a pushy theatrical agent who has a nose for mystery. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies, Julia Sawalha, Steven Berkoff, Mary Tamm and Jay Benedict.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The best six chefs from the week battle it out in the third quarter-final, in which the judges test their pastry skills. First they ask them to make a sweet dish of their own invention from 10 ingredients including a fresh coconut, passionfruit, white chocolate and rum. After a double elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Tracey MacLeod, Jay Rayner and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the knockout week.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off

programme.title: The Hairy Bakers
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King travel the country to examine the UK's obsession with teatime treats. They make Bakewell tart in its original Derbyshire home and prepare a Victoria sandwich for the ladies of the WI. At Henley regatta, the duo prepare cookies with sour cherries and chocolate chips, and later serve afternoon tea to the Tees Rowing Club.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Fantastical Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal aims to rekindle people's love of traditional pub food by building a giant pie and transforming it into a fully functioning public house in the Welsh village of Minera. But that's not all - his tavern comes complete with a billiard table made from cod, tartare sauce and pea mousse - topped off with pickled egg balls - a supersized pork scratching big enough to feed the entire village and a fruit machine that pays its jackpot in snacks.(n)

programme.title: Beats, Rhymes & Life: The Travels of A Tribe Called Quest
programme.desc: Actor Michael Rapaport turns documentary filmmaker with this look at the turbulent career of progressive New York hip-hop outfit A Tribe Called Quest. Interviews with such fans and contemporaries as the Beastie Boys, De La Soul, Ludacris, Kanye West, and Common reveal how the group helped steer collective hip-hop consciousness in an exciting new direction by combining divergent styles and penning positive lyrics before deciding to call it quits back in 1998. Additional interviews with members Ali Shaheed Muhammad, Q-Tip, and Phife Dawg during their 2008 reunion tour offer added insight into their glory days as hip-hop pioneers, and life after A Tribe Called Quest(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: One woman's rocky road to the altar gets played for laughs in this comedy, adapted from the one-woman off-Broadway show written by and starring Nia Vardalos. Toula (Vardalos) is a Greek-American woman who is in her early thirties and single, with no immediate prospects of changing that status any time soon. This bothers Toula a bit, but not half as much as it distresses her mother (Lainie Kazan) and father (Michael Constantine), who want to send her to Greece in hopes of finding a husband in the old country. Toula isn't interested in leaving the country to find a man, but since she works in the family business -- a Greek restaurant in Chicago called Dancing Zorba's -- she has to hear about it whether she likes it or not. One day, after seeing a handsome stranger in the restaurant and not having the courage to talk to him, Toula decides she needs a bit of self-improvement. Despite her dad's misgivings, Toula signs up for a night-school class studying computers, trades in her glasses for contact lenses, gets a different job at a travel agency, and spruces herself up with a new look and a new attitude. To her very pleasant surprise, she once again encounters the handsome stranger, who soon asks her out on a date. Schoolteacher Ian Miller (John Corbett) is seemingly perfect -- he's tall, handsome, smart, good-natured, and soon in love with Toula -- except for two little things: he's not Greek, and he's a vegetarian, both of which horrify Toula's family. When Ian pops the question (and Toula says yes), the bride-to-be has to negotiate a reasonably peaceful meeting between Ian's upper-class parents and her own working-class extended family. There's also the matter of the wedding, which Toula's mother is planning around the notion that quantity IS quality. My Big Fat Greek Wedding also features Ian Gomez (Vardalos' real-life husband), Louis Mandylor, Andrea Martin, and Joey Fatone (from the pop group *NSYNC). Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson helped produce the film through the auspices of their production company, Playtone(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: This mockumentary satire of the music business and modern celebrity centers on self-absorbed pop rapper Conner4Real (Andy Samberg). Once a member of a popular rap trio called the Style Boyz, Conner is now a solo artist about to drop his second album. Unfortunately, the release gets abysmal reviews, and his career begins to melt down when his attempts at rehabing his image lead to such disasters as a global blackout and a proposal to his girlfriend interrupted by a wolf attack. Eventually, Conner considers burying the hatchet with former colleagues Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) in order to reunite the Style Boyz. Tim Meadows, Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, and Imogen Poots co-star. Samberg, Taccone, and Schaffer co-wrote the screenplay, while Taccone and Schaffer shared directing duties(n)
