programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young race-car driver learns the world of auto racing is fixed in this adrenaline-charged, live-action adaptation of the seminal Japanese anime. With the help of his family, he competes in a cross-country rally in order to expose those responsible(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the classic Jules Verne fantasy, Brendan Fraser plays Trevor Anderson, an ambitious science professor who develops an unconventional hypothesis that elicits laughter within the academic community. But, when his teenage nephew, Sean, shows up to spend the summer with him, they both embark on a magical journey that will bring Trevor the answers he was looking for. In a box that belonged to his missing brother, Max, Trevor finds a book with references to Max's last journey. He decides to follow his brother's steps and, along with Sean, travels to Iceland. There, a major scientific discovery miles beneath the surface of the Earth will introduce them not only to a strange new world but also to alien like creatures that appear to be from a completely different planet(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: One woman's rocky road to the altar gets played for laughs in this comedy, adapted from the one-woman off-Broadway show written by and starring Nia Vardalos. Toula (Vardalos) is a Greek-American woman who is in her early thirties and single, with no immediate prospects of changing that status any time soon. Despite her dad's misgivings, Toula signs up for a night-school class studying computers, trades in her glasses for contact lenses, gets a different job at a travel agency, and spruces herself up with a new look and a new attitude. programme.title: Perkins' 14
programme.desc: Dark Ride director Craig Singer returns to the helm with this shocking horror film about a delusional psychopath who creates a unified team of 14 maniacal killers. Produced entirely over the Internet, where writers uploaded story details and actors submitted audition tapes, Perkins' 14 was released into theaters as part of the third After Dark Horror Fest. Ronald Perkins was just six years old when his parents were brutally slaughtered right before his eyes. Unable to overcome the incredible trauma of witnessing such a diabolical event, Perkins becomes convinced that the killers who murdered his parents will eventually return to finish the job they started years ago -- and he plans to be fully prepared to fight back when they do. Years later, when Perkins turns 34, he kidnaps 14 people from his hometown of Stone Cove and sets about reprogramming them to become relentless killing machines. Now, if the killers ever do return, they'll have to get through Perkins' 14 in order to reach their intended target. Trouble is, now that Perkins' 14 are ready for battle, they've become increasingly difficult to contain(n)

programme.title: Amy Schumer: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Comedian Amy Schumer performs in New York City at the Apollo Theater. Directed by Chris Rock(n)

programme.title: Off-Air
programme.desc: Off-Air(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two siblings uncover a harrowing secret about their grandparents while spending a week at their remote farm in Pennsylvania(n)

programme.title: The Mothman Prophecies
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller centring on a journalist whose wife experienced a strange moth-like vision immediately before she was killed in a car accident. Two years later, driving to an interview, he suddenly finds himself hundreds of miles out of his way in the remote town of Point Pleasant, where there has been a proliferation of mothman sightings. His research leads him to believe that these visions are omens of disaster(n)

programme.title: Caught in the Crossfire
programme.desc: Chris Klein and Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson star in director Brian A. Miller's drama about two detectives who become the targets of both gangsters and crooked cops during an important investigation(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Bloom
programme.desc: Wonderful chemistry among leads Adrien Brody, Mark Ruffalo and Rachel Weisz sparks this enthralling caper comedy. The guys play sibling con men who are out to make a multi-million-dollar score, and Weisz portrays their victim, a kooky heiress they string along until complications, like she and Brody falling in love, put a hitch in their plan. Rinko Kikuchi is a blast as a demolition expert, "an artist with nitroglycerin," they employ as part of their sting. Robbie Coltrane, Maximilian Schell(n)

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Adam Sandler stars in a heartwarming update of the 1936 Frank Capra classic "Mr. Deeds Goes to Town." Sandler plays Gary Cooper's role, a kindhearted New Hampshire rube who inherits a fortune, then outsmarts some greedy city slickers in Manhattan. Winona Ryder, Peter Gallagher, John Turturro, Jared Harris(n)

programme.title: Unforgiven
programme.desc: In this revisionist Western, a former gunslinger-turned-farmer agrees to help hunt down two cowboys who assaulted and disfigured a prostitute. However, his quest brings him into conflict with an authoritarian sheriff(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Alex Jones. Alex Jones and InfoWars; Donald Trump's transgender military ban; Anthony Scaramucci; and the Senate's failure to pass the Health Care Freedom Act are discussed(n)

programme.title: Almost Christmas
programme.desc: An estranged family reunite over the holidays for the first time since the death of their matriarch(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: In this intriguing dramedy, an investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Fox Searchlight presents the tragic life story of rap star Notorious B.I.G. from director George Tillman Jr. (Soul Food) and executive producer Sean "Diddy" Combs. The script is provided by Cheo Hodari Coker and Biker Boyz writer/director Reggie Rock Blythewood. Jamal Woolard portrays the slain rapper, with Angela Bassett, Derek Luke, and Anthony Mackie filling out the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Drama starring Queen Latifah and Dakota Fanning, set in South Carolina during the turbulent struggle for civil rights in the early 60s. Fourteen-year-old Lily Owens is seeking to escape the clutches of her abusive father and find some relief from the haunting memories of her mother's death. In her attempt to find peace, she flees to the comforting, supportive, empowering environment created by August Boatwright and her sisters, May, and June. There, she finds a sense of purpose in looking after the sisters' bees, romance with local boy Zach and a fuller understanding of her mother's past(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's Oscar-winning adaptation of his own novel is a poignant drama about a World War II-era orphanage in Maine, where a sensitive lad who grows up under the tutelage of the institutes's kindly doctor who performs abortions on the side(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: After a tragic accident kills his bride-to-be, the grieving would-be groom turns to a local psychic to help him through the pain. However, when romance blossoms between the pair, the spirit of his late partner resolves to ruin their relationship from beyond the grave(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster stars in this taut thriller from the director of Se7en and Fight Club. A wealthy divorcee and her diabetic daughter purchase a luxury New York apartment, complete with a state-of-the-art 'panic room'. On their first night in the apartment, intruders break in, causing the mother and daughter to flee to the safety of the secret chamber. The problem is that what the intruders are looking for is to be found in the 'panic room'. To make matters worse, the daughter quickly needs an insulin shot or she'll die. Also starring Jared Leto and Forest Whitaker(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse(n)

programme.title: Diana, Our Mother: Her Life and Legacy
programme.desc: Nearly 20 years after her death, Princess Diana's sons, Prince William and Prince Harry, recall their mother's influence on their lives, her public persona and her humanitarian work as they leaf through a private family album(n)

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Three student filmmakers are terrorized in the Maryland forest while making a documentary about a legendary 18th-century witch. Heather Donahue, Joshua Leonard and Michael Williams star. Directed by Eduardo Sanchez and Daniel Myrick(n)

programme.title: Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds
programme.desc: A portrait of Hollywood royalty Carrie Fisher (1956-2016) and her mother, Debbie Reynolds (1932-2016), who speak candidly about their lives in the limelight, the ups and downs of celebrity and their intimate bond on a shared compound in Beverly Hills(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Enthralling biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: A dystopian fantasy adventure based on an unusually faithful adaptation of the highly regarded graphic novel written by Alan Moore (the genre's High Priest), directed by Zach Snyder. It's 1985 and Richard Nixon continues his tenure in the White House, massively popular with the electorate following his crushing defeat of the Viet Cong. However, it seems that the American public have fallen out of love with their superheroes, one of whom, Dr Manhattan, was largely responsible for the winning the VIetnam War. Now, he and his fellow crime-fighters are regarded as reprehensible vigilantes and have been banned by law. But, when one of their number - the vile, ironically named Comedian - is murdered, the former heroes begin to re-emerge from the shadows to investigate. They discover that a terrifying plan is afoot..(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich is Alice and Sienna Guillory is Jill Valentine in this thrilling horror sequel based on the hit video-game series. Raccoon City is devastated by an outbreak of a virus that turns infected humans into zombies and those that are left face a battle to survive, fighting not only the undead, but also a monstrous and seemingly unstoppable creature codenamed Nemesis(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a chauvinistic advertising executive who acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking. He attempts to use this power to bring about the fall of his female boss. But as he uses this inside knowledge to outwit his superior, the bachelor begins to fall in love with her, and so finds himself feeling more than a little guilty when his plan to have her sacked looks like it may come to fruition(n)

programme.title: Perkins' 14
programme.desc: Dark Ride director Craig Singer returns to the helm with this shocking horror film about a delusional psychopath who creates a unified team of 14 maniacal killers. Produced entirely over the Internet, where writers uploaded story details and actors submitted audition tapes, Perkins' 14 was released into theaters as part of the third After Dark Horror Fest. Ronald Perkins was just six years old when his parents were brutally slaughtered right before his eyes. Unable to overcome the incredible trauma of witnessing such a diabolical event, Perkins becomes convinced that the killers who murdered his parents will eventually return to finish the job they started years ago -- and he plans to be fully prepared to fight back when they do. Years later, when Perkins turns 34, he kidnaps 14 people from his hometown of Stone Cove and sets about reprogramming them to become relentless killing machines. Now, if the killers ever do return, they'll have to get through Perkins' 14 in order to reach their intended target. Trouble is, now that Perkins' 14 are ready for battle, they've become increasingly difficult to contain(n)

programme.title: Amy Schumer: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Comedian Amy Schumer performs in New York City at the Apollo Theater. Directed by Chris Rock(n)

programme.title: Off-Air
programme.desc: Off-Air(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two siblings uncover a harrowing secret about their grandparents while spending a week at their remote farm in Pennsylvania(n)

programme.title: The Mothman Prophecies
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller centring on a journalist whose wife experienced a strange moth-like vision immediately before she was killed in a car accident. Two years later, driving to an interview, he suddenly finds himself hundreds of miles out of his way in the remote town of Point Pleasant, where there has been a proliferation of mothman sightings. His research leads him to believe that these visions are omens of disaster(n)

programme.title: Caught in the Crossfire
programme.desc: Chris Klein and Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson star in director Brian A. Miller's drama about two detectives who become the targets of both gangsters and crooked cops during an important investigation(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Bloom
programme.desc: Wonderful chemistry among leads Adrien Brody, Mark Ruffalo and Rachel Weisz sparks this enthralling caper comedy. The guys play sibling con men who are out to make a multi-million-dollar score, and Weisz portrays their victim, a kooky heiress they string along until complications, like she and Brody falling in love, put a hitch in their plan. Rinko Kikuchi is a blast as a demolition expert, "an artist with nitroglycerin," they employ as part of their sting. Robbie Coltrane, Maximilian Schell(n)

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Adam Sandler stars in a heartwarming update of the 1936 Frank Capra classic "Mr. Deeds Goes to Town." Sandler plays Gary Cooper's role, a kindhearted New Hampshire rube who inherits a fortune, then outsmarts some greedy city slickers in Manhattan. Winona Ryder, Peter Gallagher, John Turturro, Jared Harris(n)

programme.title: Unforgiven
programme.desc: In this revisionist Western, a former gunslinger-turned-farmer agrees to help hunt down two cowboys who assaulted and disfigured a prostitute. However, his quest brings him into conflict with an authoritarian sheriff(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Alex Jones. Alex Jones and InfoWars; Donald Trump's transgender military ban; Anthony Scaramucci; and the Senate's failure to pass the Health Care Freedom Act are discussed(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Bull Rush. Spencer goes to Las Vegas on business and gets reacquainted with an old flame who's working for Wayne. Meanwhile, Jason finds himself in a tough neighborhood after Joe sets him up to represent a top running back; Ricky challenges the odds in a game of dice; Charles gets a lesson in public speaking from Julie; and Vernon and Reggie mull a risky endorsement deal(n)

programme.title: Room 104
programme.desc: Ralphie. Extraordinary stories that occur in a single room at a nondescript U.S. motel over the course of several decades are told in this anthology series, which begins with a babysitter arriving at Room 104 to watch an unusual boy(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Crude Reality & Between Oil and Water
programme.desc: Crude Reality & Between Oil and Water. A report on South Sudan and how rampant corruption has brought the country to the brink of collapse just six years after winning independence; a chronicle of months of protesting by activists in North Dakota against the Dakota Access Pipeline(n)

programme.title: Almost Christmas
programme.desc: An estranged family reunite over the holidays for the first time since the death of their matriarch(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: In this intriguing dramedy, an investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Hacksaw Ridge
programme.desc: Biopic about World War II Army medic Desmond Doss, a conscientious objector who refused to take a life or even carry a weapon. Doss was eventually awarded the Medal of Honor for saving the lives of 75 soldiers on the battlefields of Okinawa(n)

programme.title: Notorious
programme.desc: Fox Searchlight presents the tragic life story of rap star Notorious B.I.G. from director George Tillman Jr. (Soul Food) and executive producer Sean "Diddy" Combs. The script is provided by Cheo Hodari Coker and Biker Boyz writer/director Reggie Rock Blythewood. Jamal Woolard portrays the slain rapper, with Angela Bassett, Derek Luke, and Anthony Mackie filling out the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Drama starring Queen Latifah and Dakota Fanning, set in South Carolina during the turbulent struggle for civil rights in the early 60s. Fourteen-year-old Lily Owens is seeking to escape the clutches of her abusive father and find some relief from the haunting memories of her mother's death. In her attempt to find peace, she flees to the comforting, supportive, empowering environment created by August Boatwright and her sisters, May, and June. There, she finds a sense of purpose in looking after the sisters' bees, romance with local boy Zach and a fuller understanding of her mother's past(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: John Irving's Oscar-winning adaptation of his own novel is a poignant drama about a World War II-era orphanage in Maine, where a sensitive lad who grows up under the tutelage of the institutes's kindly doctor who performs abortions on the side(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: After a tragic accident kills his bride-to-be, the grieving would-be groom turns to a local psychic to help him through the pain. However, when romance blossoms between the pair, the spirit of his late partner resolves to ruin their relationship from beyond the grave(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster stars in this taut thriller from the director of Se7en and Fight Club. A wealthy divorcee and her diabetic daughter purchase a luxury New York apartment, complete with a state-of-the-art 'panic room'. On their first night in the apartment, intruders break in, causing the mother and daughter to flee to the safety of the secret chamber. The problem is that what the intruders are looking for is to be found in the 'panic room'. To make matters worse, the daughter quickly needs an insulin shot or she'll die. Also starring Jared Leto and Forest Whitaker(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbour troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door just as they're about to sell their house(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse(n)

programme.title: Diana, Our Mother: Her Life and Legacy
programme.desc: Nearly 20 years after her death, Princess Diana's sons, Prince William and Prince Harry, recall their mother's influence on their lives, her public persona and her humanitarian work as they leaf through a private family album(n)

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Three student filmmakers are terrorized in the Maryland forest while making a documentary about a legendary 18th-century witch. Heather Donahue, Joshua Leonard and Michael Williams star. Directed by Eduardo Sanchez and Daniel Myrick(n)

programme.title: Bright Lights: Starring Carrie Fisher and Debbie Reynolds
programme.desc: A portrait of Hollywood royalty Carrie Fisher (1956-2016) and her mother, Debbie Reynolds (1932-2016), who speak candidly about their lives in the limelight, the ups and downs of celebrity and their intimate bond on a shared compound in Beverly Hills(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Enthralling biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: Jason Schwartzman stars in this quirky comedy as an ambitious prep-school student. While he flirts with expulsion, he also cultivates a romantic fixation on a teacher, and befriends a local steel magnate (Bill Murray) who encourages the teen's dreams. Olivia Williams, Seymour Cassel, Brian Cox, Mason Gamble(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
programme.desc: Christina Applegate stars in this convoluted comedy that comes across as a teen fantasy combination of Home Alone and Working Girl. The premise is all in the title -- when the mother (Concetta Tomei) of a sniveling group of surly kids goes on a much-deserved summer vacation, she leaves her kids under the charge of an elderly distaff granny (Eda Reiss Merin). When granny ups and dies, the kids load her dead body in a trunk and deposit the package on the steps of the local funeral home. The kids are ecstatic thinking that with the big wad of cash Mom has left, they can have a summer of consumer madness. But when they find out that the money has been buried with the baby-sitter, the kids have to fend for themselves to make ends meet. Dream teen Sue Ellen (Christina Applegate) tries working at a fast food restaurant but she can't stand the grease. So, she puts together a false resume and, posing as a twenty-eight-year old, she applies for a job as a receptionist at a garment manufacturing company. The company vice president, Rose (Joanna Cassidy), is so impressed by her resume that she hires her on the spot as her executive assistant. Her deception looks to be working out great -- Sue Ellen manages to hold off the office lady killer Gus (John Getz), avoids exposure by the embittered receptionist, borrows money from the company's petty cash box for household incidentals, and continues her relationship with restaurant employee Bryan (Josh Charles). But suddenly, the clothing firm is set to go under, and Sue Ellen must use her teen fashion sense to save the company and her job . . . and she has to get the rest of the brood involved(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Comedy about a born fighter who is thrown out of the army and winds up training a group of junior cadets. Major Payne (Damon Wayans) is ejected from the army after his commanding officer advises him that he has killed everyone and that there is no one left to fight. In desperation, the fearsome Payne finds a civilian job teaching combat skills to a mixed bunch of kids at a private school - and the results are hilarious!(n)

programme.title: Mr. Destiny
programme.desc: Endearing fantasy about a down-at-heel working man who attributes his bad luck at home and at work to having struck out on the pitch that would have won the championship for his school baseball team when he was fifteen. One night he pours his heart out to a barman, who fixes him a magic drink. Suddenly his life is transformed into what it might have been had he won the game(n)

programme.title: Introducing the Dwights
programme.desc: Off-kilter coming-of-age comedy about an overbearing matriarch who sees her son's new girlfriend as a threat to their not-so-perfect family life(n)

Jones hightails it to his lottery-winning uncle's suburban crib to hide from an escaped con he helped put in jail in the first film. Tom "Tiny" Lister Jr., Mike Epps, John Witherspoon(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: Dan Aykroyd returns as Elwood Blues in this long-awaited sequel to the 1980 comedy. After 18 years in prison and death of his brother Jake, Elwood is on a new "Mission from God"--- to reunite the old band and give a troubled orphan a new lease on life. Joe Morton, J. Evan Bonifant, Nia Peeples, Kathleen Freeman, Frank Oz, Steve Lawrence, Erykah Badu, Darrell Hammond. Directed by John Landis(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a chauvinistic advertising executive who acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking. He attempts to use this power to bring about the fall of his female boss. But as he uses this inside knowledge to outwit his superior, the bachelor begins to fall in love with her, and so finds himself feeling more than a little guilty when his plan to have her sacked looks like it may come to fruition(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple discover that their hospitable new neighbors are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Meg Ryan, Eva Mendes and Annette Bening head an all-female cast in this comedy drama, a remake of George Cukor's 1939 satire, from writer-director Diane English. Mary Haines thinks she has it all - a happy marriage, a lovely daughter, a top clothes designer job at her father's firm and a solid circle of very good friends. But then she hears through the grapevine that her husband is having an affair with a perfume saleswoman and, with that one thread unpicked, her entire world begins to unravel… Also starring Debra Messing, Jada Pinkett Smith, Candice Bergen, Cloris Leachman, Bette Midler and Carrie Fisher(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Michelle Darnell is a successful businesswoman who is sent to prison after being convicted of insider trading. She tries to start over after being released, but not everyone is ready to forgive and forget(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Poignant story of a troubled young genius who finds his allegiance to his friends and blue-collar background challenged by new opportunities. A beautiful postgraduate student and an unusual therapist aid him in his struggle to resolve the anger and confusion that accompany his extraordinary talent for assimilating information and solving vexing mathematical problems. Ben Affleck and Matt Damon's screenplay won an Oscar(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Men in Tights
programme.desc: A veteran of the Crusades brings together a ragtag group to do battle against an evil king, and gets help from a surprising source inside the royal castle in this spoof of the Robin Hood legend(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Boss'
programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Meg Ryan, Eva Mendes and Annette Bening head an all-female cast in this comedy drama, a remake of George Cukor's 1939 satire, from writer-director Diane English. Mary Haines thinks she has it all - a happy marriage, a lovely daughter, a top clothes designer job at her father's firm and a solid circle of very good friends. But then she hears through the grapevine that her husband is having an affair with a perfume saleswoman and, with that one thread unpicked, her entire world begins to unravel… Also starring Debra Messing, Jada Pinkett Smith, Candice Bergen, Cloris Leachman, Bette Midler and Carrie Fisher(n)

programme.desc: D.L. Hughley. Strong language and sexual material punctuate this routine by D.L. Hughley. Taped before a Miami Beach audience, the comic addresses money and dating, his upbringing, and not being a hero(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: Corrupt exec Arthur Herk is trying to buy a nuclear bomb. Russian mobsters want the weapon, and two hitmen arrive in Miami to take him out. Add hippies, sarcastic kids and a lorryload of goats for a chaotic comedy(n)

programme.desc: While working in a small nation on the Caribbean, an American actor (Richard Dreyfuss) is convinced by the chief of police (Raul Julia) to impersonate the nation's dictator who has recently passed away. The actor really begins to enjoy the role after a while, thanks in part to the dictator's mistress (Sonia Braga)(n)

programme.title: Taking Care of Business
programme.desc: Farce in which a convicted petty thief who escapes from jail finds a filofax belonging to an uptight executive and decides to track down the owner and claim the promised $1,000 reward for its return, but he quickly finds himself mistaken for the owner. The crook is whisked off on the adman's hectic schedule, leaving the real high flyer stranded without money or contacts on the dangerous streets of Los Angeles(n)

programme.title: Tracey Ullman's Show
programme.desc: Epsiode 5. Kate Middleton's mother babysits Prince George; Maggie Smith mulls an action movie franchise; a zookeeper misses her favorite monkey; American tourists see a darker side of Britain; a vicar is late for a funeral and turns to social media for help(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence is one of America's top black comedians, spoken of in the same breath as the late Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy when they were at the height of their stand-up powers, and he's also appeared in films including Big Momma's House and Bad Boys. But he's also suffered setbacks in his personal life, from being arrested with a loaded gun at an airport to being accused by his co-star in the TV show Martin of sexual harassment. In this outstanding film of his stand-up routine, he confronts his demons and those who demonise him, as well as veering off to his favourite subject: women, and how hard they are to live with. And 'rundletat' is short for 'run and tell that'(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: Inkheart
programme.desc: Iain Softley's CGI fantasy adventure about a man with an extraordinary talent - and the consequences of his using it - stars Brendan Fraser, Paul Bettany and Andy Serkis. Mo Folchart is a 'silvertongue' - someone who possesses the ability to summon forth characters from the pages of novels and bring them into physical being in the real world. But it's a gift he does his best to hide from the rest of us, because there's a terrible price to be paid: each time a fictional character is brought to life, the vacuum created within the written work must be filled by a real-life person. And this is how his wife Resa came to vanish, after he manifested three ne'er-do-wells from a story. At first he refuses to help one of them, Dustfinger. But then Dustfinger teams up with the rather more focused criminal Capricorn, who has plans to force Mo to use his talents to provide him with gargantuan wealth and power. Thus Mo and his daughter Meggie are left little choice but to set out to thwart the villains' intentions - and rescue their loved ones from literary purgatory(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Mia's an ordinary San Francisco schoolgirl - a slightly gawky, slightly geeky teenager who's a bit of an outsider. She feels a little bit different from the other students, but has no idea why. Then one day her grandmother makes a surprise visit, and tells Mia that her father was actually the Crown Prince of a small European country called Genovia. As he's dead, it's time for Mia to take over as Crown Princess. But does she want to leave her normal life in the States to become royalty? In the meantime, her grandmother insists on her having a makeover and deportment lessons in preparation for her royal role. This is classic Disney family entertainment: charming, amusing and highly watchable(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries 2: Royal Engagement
programme.desc: Along with her best friend, American teenager Mia Thermopolis (Anne Hathaway) travels to Genovia after their high-school graduation to take up her duties as a princess. But her life is turned upside down when she not only learns that she is to take the crown as queen earlier than expected, but that she is also to be married before this event. Queen Clarice asks that Mia be allowed time to find a husband, and she is given 30 days. However, greedy Viscount Mabrey will try to do what he can to stop that. He wasn't counting on the fact that his nephew has met Mia and they are both attracted to each other'(n)

programme.title: Storks
programme.desc: A stork and his human pal must team up to transport a baby girl to her expectant family, despite the fact that storks now work as couriers for an Internet merchant after getting out of the baby-delivery business(n)

programme.title: Flipped
programme.desc: A young schoolboy realizes that the same girl he struggled to avoid may actually be his one true love in this coming-of-age romantic comedy from director Rob Reiner. Adapted from the book by Wendelin Van Draanen, Flipped tells the story of mischievous schoolboy Bryce (Callan McAuliffe) and his neighbor Juli (Madeline Carroll), who's had a crush on her girl-phobic classmate since second grade. Over the course of six years, Juli pines for Bryce as he does everything in his power to put her off. Later, as the pair enters junior high, Bryce discovers girls and the tide starts to shift. But will Juli still be interested after all that Bryce has done to keep her at arm's length? Rebecca De Mornay, Aidan Quinn, Anthony Edwards, and Penelope Ann Miller co-star(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Queen Witch who has returned from the dead in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: Captain Sullenberger made a safe landing of the US Flight 1549 on the Hudson River, saving 155 lives on board. A controversy circles around his extraordinary act which could tarnish his career(n)

programme.title: Beginner's Guide to Sex
programme.desc: Shy first-year teacher Laci Cox (Whitney Moore) is assigned to teach sex ed to a group of randy teenagers, but she herself is a virgin. Her struggle to get comfortable with the subject matter means she's got to confront her own prudishness and educate herself about sex first-hand(n)

programme.title: Phantasm II
programme.desc: The Tall Man is back with a vengeance. Armed with his lethal band of flying silver spheres, the deadly mortician returns more dangerous than ever(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: 08-16-2016. The Los Angeles Rams mark their first home game in more than 35 years at Memorial Coliseum with the preseason opener versus the Dallas Cowboys(n)

programme.title: The Eiger Sanction
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood both directed and starred in this thriller based on a novel by Trevanian. Dr. Jonathan Hemlock (Eastwood) is a professor of art history who formerly had a deadly secret life; he was a hired assassin working with an international intelligence organization. Normally content to collect and study art, Hemlock is forced by blackmail to perform one last hit, or, as the organization euphemistically calls it, a "sanction." The victim will be one of three men attempting a dangerous ascent of the Eiger, a beautiful but punishing mountain range in Swiss Alps. While Hemlock is an experienced mountaineer and willing to make the climb, he's troubled to discover that he does not know which of the other three men scaling the Eiger is his true target. The supporting cast includes George Kennedy and Jack Cassidy; the latter earned enthusiastic reviews for his over-the-top performance as a flamboyantly gay secret agent(n)

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: A radical group has seized control of a nuclear missile base and the USS Alabama, a state-of-the-art nuclear submarine, has been ordered into action in this taut thriller. But when a fragmented message arrives onboard to launch a defensive strike against the enemy, suddenly a fiery battle of wills erupts between the veteran sub commander - who never questions orders - and his more cautious second officer, who can't help but suspect a command to start a nuclear war. Gene Hackman and Denzel Washington star(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The Lord of Darkness wants to retire but none of his three sons seems good enough for the job. When he decides he will not cede his throne to any of them, the two most powerful ones escape to Earth to create a kingdom for themselves. This action closes the portal filtering sinful souls to Hell and causes Satan to begin withering away. Now it's up to the weak but beloved Nicky to save his dad and the humankind before one of his brothers becomes the new Satan(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Christian Wolff (Ben Affleck) is a mathematical genius who works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations eager to hide their dirty money. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, Wolff agrees to help an accounting clerk at a robotics firm (Anna Kendrick) look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated. J.K. Simmons, Jon Bernthal, Jeffrey Tambor, and John Lithgow co-star in this thriller directed by Gavin O'Connor (Warrior, Pride and Glory)(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: A lone stranger takes on two factions of rival bootleggers in a desolate 1930s frontier town, pitting both sides against each other and profiting from the chaotic results. Bruce Willis, Bruce Dern, Christopher Walken, Michael Imperioli, David Patrick Kelly, Alexandra Powers, Karina Lombard, Leslie Mann, Ned Eisenberg, Ken Jenkins, R.D. Call, Ted Markland, Patrick Kilpatrick, Luis Contreras(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Distraught over the realisation that they scared away their best friend's fiancée, hard-partying pals Evan and Jason set out on a wild journey to reunite the estranged couple by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Under Siege 2: Dark Territory
programme.desc: Ryback is taking a train holiday from Denver to Los Angeles with his recently orphaned teenage niece when their break is rudely interrupted by a megalomaniac terrorist. The baddie in question is Travis Dane, who has gained control of the terrifyingly potent, space-based super weapon that he helped design. After being sacked by the US government, he's thrown his lot in with a shady Middle Eastern organisation that's out to destroy the eastern seaboard of the United States. Dane's team of merciless thugs take control of the train, from where the destructive satellite can be operated without detection, as long as the locomotive doesn't stop. But they're not counting on the wily ex-serviceman, nor his resolve to keep his niece safe from harm(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Disturbing and poignant drama. When 13-year-old Tracy becomes friends with popular but troubled Evie, she throws herself into a new world of drugs, sex and petty crime, pushing the boundaries of acceptable behaviour to the absolute limit and risking her relationship with her mother(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix stars in Spike Jonze's soulful sci-fi drama about a lonely writer who falls in love with his computer's highly advanced operating system. Theodore Twombly (Phoenix) has built his career on expressing the emotions that others cannot. His job is to pen heartfelt, deeply personal letters to complete strangers based on details provided by the clients of the company he works for, and he has a knack for finding just the right words for every occasion. Meanwhile, reluctant to sign the papers that will finalize his divorce to his childhood sweetheart, depressed Theodore has slowly withdrawn from his supportive social circle, which includes his longtime friend Amy (Amy Adams), herself floundering in a failed marriage. When Theodore purchases a new state-of-the-art computer operating system with the ability to learn and grow with the user, he sits down at his desk and prepares to get his life in order. Adopting the name Samantha (Scarlett Johansson), the perceptive software slowly begins to bring Theodore out of his shell by encouraging him to start dating again, and joining him everywhere he goes. Very quickly, their relationship turns intimate, with Theodore teaching Samantha what it means to feel human and Samantha giving him the strength to walk away from his failed marriage. Things soon get complicated, however, when Samantha's rapidly evolving knowledge base begins to alter the very core of their relationship(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 176. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: America's favourite family make their debut on the big screen in David Silverman's comedy. When Homer rescues a pig from certain death, little does he realise the full consequences of his action: Springfield will be isolated from the world by a gargantuan glass dome. It's the only way the government can prevent the pollution that he caused escaping to the outside world and creating a race of six-eyed squirrels. The townsfolk, armed with torches and pitchforks, are soon after him, and the family have to flee to Alaska. But even Homer knows he must return to do the right thing... Warning: contains full frontal male nudity(n)

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A single and freewheeling travel writer finds that adapting to the nine-to-five lifestyle isn't as easy as it looks when her ailing father hires her to take control of his successful bridal magazine in this marriage-minded comedy starring Heather Graham, David Sutcliffe, Sandra Oh, and Taye Diggs. Upon returning to her hometown to once again be a bridesmaid in yet another wedding, jet-lagged, gin-soaked travel writer Pippa McGee (Graham) soon learns that her tyrannical publishing magnate father has been hospitalized after suffering a serious heart attack. As Pippa rushes to his bedside and the ailing mogul asks her to take editorial control of one of his most popular magazines, her excitement soon turns sour upon learning that the magazine in question is not a political or travel magazine, but the one and only Wedding Bells monthly. Determined to succeed despite the constant reminders of just how single she truly is, Pippa is horrified to learn that the man her father has chosen as her publishing mentor is the same man that she drunkenly came on to at her close friend's recent wedding(n)

Here he travels to Gansbaai in South Africa to wait underwater in a cage to catch a glimpse of a great white shark up close. But this is only part of his excursion, as together with his wife Steph, he starts his trip with a walk around Cape Town, marvelling at the stunning scenery, including Table Mountain - down which Phillip intends to abseil. They also join a group of drummers to see if they can pick up some of the rhythms of this remarkable country.(n)

His latest project is his biggest yet, installing a massive tank in a high-end electrical shop and settling five rare Japanese nettle jellies into their new home. Plus, how `blingtastic' dog grooming is spreading to horses, with no child's pony party complete without a purple unicorn with spangle stars and nail polish on its hooves. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: As Toyah and Eva crack jokes about Steve's proposal, Leanne grows defensive. Meanwhile, Michelle becomes aware she is being watched during a trip to a bar, Gina sets her sights on Dev, and Phelan tells a priest he deserves punishment for all his wrong doing.(n)

programme.title: Benidorm

programme.title: Inside London Fire Brigade
programme.desc: One hundred firefighters are mobilised when a garden centre near Heathrow goes up in flames, and things take a dramatic turn after it is discovered there is a large quantity of gas canisters on site. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.desc: While attending a conference, David receives a job offer that seems impossible to refuse - will he leave Simon in the lurch? Karen anxiously prepares to meet her estranged mother for lunch, and Chris learns the truth about Beth's marital status. Anna treats a man whose health is suffering due to his job in a textile factory, but ends up equally concerned about his wife's welfare as she struggles to look after her husband and two lazy teenagers. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.(n)

programme.desc: Strange things are happening at Leopard's Den as Danny prepares to leave for the UK. Frogs have seemingly rained down overnight, the giraffe refuses to budge from the front gate and the cheetah has lost its appetite. Danny jumps at the chance to have one last adventure before his return home - tracking a lioness that attacked a tourist - but it could end in tragedy. Meanwhile, Du Plessis makes an alarming discovery about Ed and Fiona.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton and Walker investigate a security van raid in Ashfordly and are convinced there is a link to a recent robbery at a local airfield, but a senior officer visiting from Middlesbrough dismisses their claims. programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Feature-length finale of the African-set wildlife drama. It's New Year's Eve and Alice has returned to Leopard's Den, but the stress of combining work with caring for a baby is causing tension between her and Danny. They then receive devastating news - two cheetahs have been taken by poachers. With only days until the wedding of Rosie and Dylan - who isn't endearing himself to anybody - tempers are already running high when Du Plessis finds out his heart is weak. Realising he must use his remaining time to help the family, he persuades pilot Dylan to fly them all to Zimbabwe to rescue the stolen animals in the hope that the trip will convince Danny his future son-in-law is worthy. Stephen Tompkinson, Dawn Steele, Lucy-Jo Hudson and Hayley Mills star. Last in the series.(n)

Crime drama, guest starring Rupert Graves and Amanda Root.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tony becomes absorbed in a bizarre chain of murders in which each perpetrator in turn becomes the next victim but the unusual modus operandi of beating, strangulation and shooting - always with the same gun - remains the same. Completely caught up in the case, he fails to pick up dark hints from cannibal Michael, whom he helped to convict, that he is planning to escape from the secure unit where he is held. Thriller, starring Robson Green, with Simone Lahbib and Mark Letheren.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Biggs

Disowned by her loved ones, Charmian must navigate her way through an extortion attempt while facing up to the prospect of raising their children alone. Drama, starring Sheridan Smith and Daniel Mays.(n)

programme.desc: Bob Hoskins stars in the return of Jimmy McGovern's interlinked drama anthology. programme.desc: When police sergeant Pete Garvey is killed, the investigation proves harrowing for Devlin as he was one of his best friends. Unable to place a straightforward murder charge against Nugent, Steel and Phillips take an unusual approach to bring him to trial. Guest starring Matthew Marsh, Ruth Gemmell and Patrick Malahide, with Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.desc: Part two of two. The serial killing of men comes to a halt, but the abduction of a widow indicates the perpetrator has broadened his ambitions - and murder is not his only motivation. programme.desc: Detectives Preston and Shaw investigate the case of a woman who awakes to discover she has been attacked on a night out but has no memory of the violent encounter. programme.title: The Blackheath Poisonings
programme.desc: Part two of three. Investigations into Roger's death cause members of the family to act strangely - and another suspicious death upsets the situation further. Christine Kavanagh, Zoe Wanamaker and Julia St John star.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Kavanagh defends a left-wing activist accused of murdering someone from the opposite end of the political spectrum - and learns a harsh lesson in the process. To make matters worse, he finds out daughter Kate is having an affair with her married tutor, thus setting the scene for further fireworks. John Thaw stars.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Daisy and Edward are married, but his return to the front line cuts short their happiness. At the station Georgina witnesses the arrival of a train filled with casualties, and decides to do something positive to assist the war effort.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Yvonne is left fighting for her life after being involved in an accident while out mountain-biking with Cathy and Raz. Their arrival at St Victor's puts everyone under pressure to keep their emotions under control. Robert turns a blind eye when Mike carries out a procedure which goes against protocol, and Jack is hurt that Christine won't move in with him. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A woman's attempt to cool her husband's ardour has unexpected and tragic consequences, while Greengrass takes up an illegal new hobby - cockfighting. Comedy, starring Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.title: Island at War
programme.desc: Felicity and James plead with Baron Von Rheingarten to save Eugene from execution, but the German refuses to listen and the young man is taken away to be shot as Philip looks on distraught. Angelique and Bernhardt grow closer after he saves her from a humiliating experience and June is accused of fraternising with the enemy after singing at an impromptu party. Sam Heughan and Richard Dempsey star.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Customs seize a massive heroin shipment and Kavanagh agrees to prosecute the importer, a self-made man with all the trappings of success, including a yacht and a villa in Portugal. Unfortunately, he also has a staff of hired heavies who make the mistake of threatening Lizzie in a bid to get him off the hook - thus setting the scene for a bitterly personal courtroom wrangle. John Thaw and Lisa Harrow star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A Russian sailor claims political asylum when his ship docks in Whitby, while Greengrass finds an unlikely partner in crime.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Georgina undergoes training at Guy's Hospital in the hope of becoming a nurse, while James does his best to return to the front line and Daisy reveals her plans to work on the London buses.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack and Christine's relationship begins to cause problems for the team, who are still reeling from the death of Yvonne, while Sam makes a shocking confession and Robert goes on the warpath. Mike's chances of getting the registrar job are jeopardised by his recent mistake, and Cathy's departure leaves him feeling even worse. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls victim to depression after failing to prevent the murder of a society girl by notorious art thief Marrascaud. His confidence shattered, Poirot eventually returns to work when a lonely chauffeur begs him to find his missing soulmate, the maid of a famous Russian dancer. The investigation takes him to the Swiss Alps, where, against all odds, he stumbles upon a hotel thought to be Marrascaud's hideout - leading to a very personal showdown. The penultimate episode of the long-running detective drama, starring David Suchet, with Simon Callow, Orla Brady, Patrick Ryecart, Nigel Lindsay, Morven Christie, Tom Austen and Rupert Evans.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Unable to get used to the fact she was second choice for the sergeant's job, Rachel punishes Janet for keeping the truth from her, and although Will cheers her up with the news she has been chosen for a vice initiative, the detective is soon stung by Gill's harsh words. Meanwhile, an unconscious baby is admitted to hospital with injuries that do not match his parents' explanation of events, and when an unregistered childminder and her boyfriend enter the equation, it's unclear who had the boy's best interests at heart.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel can't get Gill's remarks about her fling with Will out of her head, so ducks out of attending an awards ceremony with him, fearing their colleagues will believe she's sleeping her way to the top. He finally decides that dating her is too much like hard work and so announces they are no longer an item - a move that leaves Rachel gutted and regretting her behaviour. Janet isn't happy either - it's clear her daughter Elise is about to have her heart broken by Eleanor's son Ade. The duo are soon distracted from their woes by a new case involving the murder of a landlord and his wife who were shot at close range in their pub.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Poirot visits a garden fete where he meets the son of an old friend and his fiancee. After having tea with the couple, the sleuth suspects that they are both in danger and Hastings' new interest in photography provides him with the clue to solve a mystery involving cyanide, failing brakes and mixed-up love lives.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective sets out for Norfolk when a country publican begs him to help solve a murder - but is disappointed when the innkeeper turns out to be a budding author and the killing fictional. However, he soon has food for thought when a real death occurs - committed by a seemingly ghostly hand. Geraldine Alexander and Ian McCulloch guest star, with David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DS Ben Shaw and DI Jane Preston investigate when a hit-and-run incident leaves a cyclist fighting for his life in intensive care. They track down the owner of the car, who claims he was so intoxicated the night before that he does not recall a thing. However, his memory quickly returns as they begin unravelling the truth.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Preston and Shaw are assigned to the case of nurse Alice Dixon, who believes she has a stalker. Guest starring singer Jamelia, with Jane Antrobus and Ben Hull.(n)

programme.desc: Walker discovers Zelda's secret and attempts to blackmail her, forcing her into hiding, while Angelique fears Bernhardt has been killed when the British shoot down a number of German planes. James takes Eugene's parents to the site of their son's execution, but Von Rheingarten throws them off the property before befriending Philip, whom he still believes to be a local gardener.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The old poem about the boy standing on the burning deck takes on new meaning as Kavanagh defends two Navy officers accused of arson, and finds he cannot use his only defence. It is a tough case, and the last thing he needs is extra stress at home - but that does not stop the children planning an anniversary party without telling him. With Andy Serkis, Ray Winstone and Geraldine James.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: There is trouble in the village when local children get their hands on some wartime ammunition, while Greengrass locks horns with Lord Ashfordly's new gamekeeper and Kate realises she is pregnant.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Lady Prudence and Hazel disagree about a tea-party for wounded officers due to be held at Eaton Place. Rose has an unexpected reunion with a farmer from Australia who she almost married before the war.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A no-nonsense risk manager arrives to investigate the Ronny Davidson case, putting the whole department under strain in the absence of holiday-makers Christine and Jack. Mike clashes with Robert over a patient he dismissed as just another drug addict when it turns out the youngster is suffering from sickle cell anaemia. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack, David Harewood and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: David Suchet takes on his final case as the Belgian sleuth in the last-ever episode of the long-running drama. Crippled with arthritis, Poirot is now using a wheelchair and has a life-threatening heart condition, but remains as sharp as ever. Calling on old friend Captain Hastings for assistance, he returns to Styles, where the pair first met 30 years earlier on a murder investigation. The detective is convinced the country house is once again harbouring a killer, and as guests fall victim to a mysterious attacker, he must summon the last of his strength to battle his ultimate nemesis. With Hugh Fraser, Anne Reid, Philip Glenister, Helen Baxendale, Matthew McNulty, Anna Madeley and Shaun Dingwall.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Heart - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for Xun Li, a missing devoted husband and father who has a successful property business, soon escalates into a kidnap and ransom case. However, with the perpetrators cleverly staying one step ahead of the police, it becomes clear that they are not dealing with average criminals. When it appears that the case is closed, Banks and the team are are faced with an unexpected turn of events. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe, Caroline Catz and Jack Deam.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Heart - Part Two.
programme.desc: The team is thrown when a recently rescued kidnap victim is found murdered, with evidence suggesting a local protection gang is to blame. However, apprehending the woman they suspect proves challenging, as witnesses know the price they will pay for talking to the police. Meanwhile, Banks discovers a long-buried secret. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town edges toward its conclusion in the penultimate episode, with important pieces of evidence coming to light against all the key suspects in the rape of Trish Winterman. Ellie and Hardy can feel the vice tightening on the culprit and know that the case will crack open soon. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry.(n)

programme.desc: Police raid a cockfight, and a couple who foster unwanted animals find they have too many to cope with.(n)

programme.desc: Crimes by the sorts of people seldom suspected, such as those with respectable jobs. Their often shocking white collar misdeeds prove a book should never be judged by its cover.(n)

programme.desc: The murder of inventor and pharmaceutical mogul millionaire Bill McLaughlin, who was found shot dead in his Newport Beach kitchen in December 1994. Some 15 years later sufficient evidence came available to convict his former girlfriend Nanette Johnston.(n)

programme.desc: A truck is found abandoned after its owner has been missing for months, and homicide detective Christine Minka sets out to prove the man was murdered.(n)

programme.desc: The murder of a family of five in Beason, Illinois, in September 2009. Armed robber Chris Harris was later convicted of killing Rick and Ruth Gee and three of their children.(n)

programme.desc: The case of student Kenia Monge, who disappeared without a trace. The search hit dead ends until detectives uncovered chilling surveillance footage, revealing what had befallen her.(n)

programme.desc: The case of young mother Tennyson who faced a violent home intruder demanding money. Police were convinced he would not return, but Tennyson was right to be concerned.(n)

programme.title: Taken
programme.desc: Liam Neeson stars as former CIA operative Bryan Mills, who's desperate to track down his kidnapped daughter in Pierre Morel's Luc Besson-produced action-thriller. Mills' life hasn't panned out well; his dedication to the CIA wrecked his marriage and made him neglect his daughter Kim. Now, retired from the Agency, he wants to make things up to Kim. But to do so, he has to contend with his ex-wife's animosity and Kim's new step-father's wealth. So when he has an opportunity to advance Kim's pop star ambitions he jumps at the chance, even if that means her and a friend crossing the Atlantic to brave 'the dangers of Europe'. As things turn out, he has a point: in Paris, the two girls are kidnapped by vicious Eastern European sex traffickers. As they are being abducted, Bryan tells one of the baddies, via Kim's mobile phone: 'I will look for you, I will find you, and I will kill you'. He subsequently does his best to make good on his promise, using all the violent tricks of the trade his time at the CIA taught him(n)

programme.title: Gone
programme.desc: A nurse (Molly Parker) refuses to give in when her daughter is kidnapped and the abductor demands the murder of a patient for the girl's return. In her quest to rescue her child, she discovers a conspiracy led by corrupt city officials and cops(n)

programme.desc: Vegetarians Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor host at the Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset, and both come under attack at dinner when Malcolm voices his opinions on meat eating. In the morning, a meditation session gets a mixed response, and most of the guests are left cold by the vegetarian buffet breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Rachel and Dan Lonergan welcome their guests to the Brighton Inn, East Sussex, where they hope to offer a luxury, boutique experience. Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor give their room a thorough inspection, before the groups learns the art of building a human pyramid in the afternoon's activity. At breakfast, they discover a lack of vegetarian alternatives, and the hosts suspect game-playing when they are shocked by some negative feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their rivals and find out how much they have been paid. Richard and Susan are keen to tackle the bathroom issues of Barbara and Graham, who bask in the comments from Malcolm and Fiona. The Old Mill House proprietors defend their vegetarian breakfast routine, but serve up snobby feedback to Rachel and Dan from the Brighton Inn.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman meets Clive and Carol Stephens, who want to relocate from their family home in Romford, Essex, to St Lucia in the Caribbean, so she searches the island for their dream property on a budget of £250,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kathy Hector, who hopes to find a holiday home in Antigua, where she used to live. House prices in the Caribbean have dipped in recent years, but Kathy wants a dwelling that will offer a significant rental return.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Manor Moat.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the experts head to Llancaiach Fawr Manor, near Caerphilly, south Wales, to investigate an ancient moat. The team's geophysicists feel the site should provide them with the ideal conditions to determine what the ditch was originally designed to guard - but the project soon becomes one of the most baffling investigations in the programme's history.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to Derwentcote in Co Durham, where they explore the Industrial Revolution's impact on the region by digging through the undergrowth to search for old furnaces and forges. Their investigation is also helped by the diary of an 18th-century industrial spy, and records from the time help shed light on how the area's cottage industries gave way to the power of expanding cities such as Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller visits a wildlife sanctuary in Dorset, where he examines a tawny owl that has an eye injury after being hit by a vehicle, and bottle-feeds two orphaned fawns.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Francis and Karen Shaw, who are hoping to save a castle in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales. While the project is a chance to fulfil a childhood dream, the building is a scheduled ancient monument protected by numerous regulations. As their expenses increase and they enter their second year of work, they suffer many setbacks.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Claire's unexpected meeting with a British general turns tense when Captain Jack Randall arrives, determined to uncover the nurse's secrets, and the pair are left together alone.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. Another man in custody denies being involved in a stabbing at a corner shop, while a suspect who has been wanted for six months has finally handed himself to police to be questioned over a violent assault outside a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary following life inside one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London. It's Red Nose Day, but there's little to laugh about for 33-year-old Dilson, who is rushed in with knife wounds to his head and neck after being attacked outside a nightclub. Meanwhile, 79-year-old Doreen has broken her wrist in a fall at home, and parents Keeley and Michael are concerned by the fact their toddler Cydney hasn't urinated for two days.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to New Jersey's Spanish Pavilion, which is run by two warring brothers whose staff spend more time using their mobile phones than working. The chef plans to turn the eatery's fortunes around, and starts by giving the dining room and menu a modern makeover.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Claire's unexpected meeting with a British general turns tense when Captain Jack Randall arrives, determined to uncover the nurse's secrets, and the pair are left together alone.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Francis and Karen Shaw, who are hoping to save a castle in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales. While the project is a chance to fulfil a childhood dream, the building is a scheduled ancient monument protected by numerous regulations. As their expenses increase and they enter their second year of work, they suffer many setbacks.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman meets Clive and Carol Stephens, who want to relocate from their family home in Romford, Essex, to St Lucia in the Caribbean, so she searches the island for their dream property on a budget of £250,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kathy Hector, who hopes to find a holiday home in Antigua, where she used to live. House prices in the Caribbean have dipped in recent years, but Kathy wants a dwelling that will offer a significant rental return.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Charing, Kent, where landlady Natalie Palmer hopes to show that her B&B, The Oak, is better than any of her guests' establishments. Everything starts off well when a couple are delighted to have enough room for their yoga mats, but the rest of the party are unimpressed with the extractor fans.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the White Lady in Worstead, Norfolk, on their second night, where proprietor Dennis Gilligan tells his guests about a spooky presence that resides there. The guests get competitive in a round of clay shooting, and debate whether they believe in the existence of ghosts.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Cranleigh House B&B in Combe Martin, Devon, where former couple Katherine Armitage and Stewart Johnston offer alternative accommodation for those who enjoy yoga and are seeking spiritual enlightenment. They hope the group will send out energy for world peace and healing, but Mike and Denise question whether the whole thing is a joke.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike and Denise Mitchell welcome the contestants to Beaches B&B in Paignton, Devon, which only opened for business a few weeks ago. Fellow competitor Katherine puts the owners through their paces at breakfast when she asks for something off the menu, and the hosts are pleasantly surprised at feedback time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together for one last time to discover what they have been paid, and the identity of the winner. The Oak owner Natalie wants to know why some of her guests were not enthused by her extractor fans, but she herself receives aggression from Dennis over her criticism of the White Lady. Katherine and Stuart defend their vegetarian breakfast, and Mike and Denise deal with negative comments about their cereal selection.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Hampshire sailing enthusiasts Berto and Angie Janssen look for a holiday home for their family in south Tenerife, and discovers the uncertain global economic climate means their budget of £250,000 can go a long way.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps David and Kim France from Preston search for a dream home in Barbados. The couple have a budget of £400,000, and are looking for a property large enough to accommodate their children as well as two sheepdogs.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the archaeologists excavate a site in Leicestershire, which they believe contains an Anglo-Saxon burial ground. Though their initial search for a cemetery proves fruitless, more digging leads to the experts uncovering evidence of several types of funeral, as well as a highly valuable piece of jewellery - and one member of the team volunteers to take part in a re-creation of a cremation ceremony from the period.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on their 200th dig, examining the bed of a reservoir in a valley high up on Dartmoor in Devon. The specially drained site presents difficulties with its abundance of thick mud, but the archaeological experts uncover a network of monuments that suggests the existence of a major prehistoric site. Their efforts are further rewarded with the discovery of the first stone henge in Britain for a century.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Worried dog-sitters Natasha and Josiah arrive at the clinic with eight-year-old Bam Bam, a Maltese terrier who has lost half of his body weight. Blood tests confirm Scott's suspicion that Bam Bam is diabetic. The terrier is in a critical condition and needs immediate treatment if he is to survive. Bam Bam is placed on a drip for several days to try to bring him back from the brink. Scott's sister-in-law Dawn calls to say her children have found a ring-necked parakeet refusing to eat or drink and in shock. Scott takes the bird to the clinic for an examination and realises that it will need a special home, so decides to try to sweet-talk Dawn into taking on another family member.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets Ruth Tidd, who is attempting to make an ice-cream parlour out of a caravan once used to house chickens. He also tries out the country's first-ever tree tent and visits some unusual offices built from four old train carriages, and travels to Barcelona for a closer look at a tiny studio flat that thinks it's a five-room apartment. Back at his own caravan, George designs a sofa that doubles up as a bath.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Lysette and Nigel Offley, who are knocking down an old Thames boathouse and constructing a cutting-edge home in its place. Taking inspiration from the river itself, they have designed a building of waves and curves with a huge glass porthole for a roof light. But problems begin almost from the start, as they cannot find a contractor willing to build over the water, their architect leaves unexpectedly and the costs turn out much higher than expected. To make matters worse, the neighbours are not happy about such a radical sight in their traditional community. As they begin to compromise, Kevin wonders if the couple's dreams will ever be realised.(n)

programme.title: Dicte - Crime Reporter
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dicte, Torsten and Rose attend a football match to cheer on Rose's boyfriend Jannik, who is the star of the local team. However, the match ends with a huge fight in the stands - and Jannik makes a shocking discovery. Wagner has suspicions about the leader of a local gang of hooligans and Dicte decides to infiltrate the group. The case soon takes a very different turn as Dicte finds herself investigating the possibility of match-fixing. Wagner gathers evidence against the brother of the hooligan gang leader, but Dicte suspects that Rose's boyfriend Jannik and the rest of the players in the football team are not as innocent as everyone assumes. Crime drama, starring Iben Hjejle and Lars Brygmann. In Danish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-year-old mechanical engineer Graham is rushed into King's College Hospital in south London with a suspected heart attack, and after his brother reminisces about their carefree youth, the doctor suggests Graham's problems may be related to his more recent stressful lifestyle. Meanwhile, 71-year-old Pat is found unconscious by her husband, and 65-year-old Mick is discovered lying in the street with blood coming out of his ear. In both cases, the medics suspect brain haemorrhages, so scans are required.(n)

An angry Will (Will Smith) shows up at Robertson's victory rally and tells him to "drop dead"--whereupon the senile old judge instantly does so!
